column1: an Elgar boundary to start us off. Deep in the crease, on his toes and a watchful nudge to fine leg as this length ball lifts up at his hips
short of a length at off stump, lifts up steeply and he's forced to arch into the leg side to allow this to pass
full on leg stump, still no hint of movement in the air. He allows it to come on and tickles it towards fine leg
a good length and just outside off. There's that climb again. Left alone
good length outside off, left alone on the front foot
full and a hint of shape away at an off stump line. Gets on the front foot and taps this to mid-on
short of a length outside off, lifts across Elgar who leaves it alone
swing, late and in at leg stump. Closely watched by Elgar and neatly tucked through square leg
short ball across off stump, left alone
in the box and now Elgar's innings has officially begun. This holds its line after shaping in and climbs past the outside edge as he fends at it
full and marginal movement in at off stump. Sliced to point on the full
short of a length in the corridor, climbs up in the corridor. Defended into the turf off the thick outside edge. Gully leaps to his right to save it
good length and shaping away outside off. Left alone
135kph, good length, swinging away outside off. Left alone
good length on off stump, nudged into the covers on the up
short of a length outside off, allows it to come on and calmly dabs this through point with full balance and soft hands
outside edge as he gets this to shape away in the corridor. Markram defends close to his body and this lands well in front of gully
full outside off. Plants the front leg forward and reaches out at this. The bat turns in his hands so he's not fully in control, but this trickles past midwicket into the boundary
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
beats the outside edge. Another one straightens past the outside edge as Elgar looks to block on the angle in
full and wide outside off, left alone
126kph, good length with a hint of swing in at the pads. Nudged to midwicket on the up
131kph, full on off stump. Tapped to mid-off with an open face
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
full and shaping away from a fifth stump line. Left alone
short ball in the corridor, drops the wrists and sways away from this
beauty. Classic Hazlewood. Belts this in at a length on off stump and nips it away marginally past the outside edge
good length and swung away from off stump. Defended on the front foot
full and just outside off. A watchful half-drive to mid-off
cuts through the defences. This jumps in from a length and beats him on the inside edge
good length and slanted across off stump, left alone
130kph, good length on leg stump, tapped past midwicket from the back foot
glory. That's what you get when Markram nails the front foot stride. 133kph outswinger outside off and he's leaned into it for an expansive drive through the covers. What balance
chipped past mid-on as this stops on him. It's a length ball down leg and he's early into the flick
overpitched on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
full on leg stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
good length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket on the up
short of a length just outside off, defended to point off the back foot
good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
good length with late movement away from off stump. Defended to point off the front foot
full outside off, dropped wide of mid-off with soft hands
short of a length and moving away outside off, left alone
full and wobbling outside off. Loose hands again and this forward defence ends up at midwicket
132kph, overpitched outswinger wide outside off, left alone
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length and just outside off, left alone
127kph, good length and just outside off. Defended on the front foot
drops a tad short outside off and Markram is onto the back foot quickly. Punches regally through the covers
full and just outside off. Leans in and drives to mid-off's left. Can't beat his slide
short of a length in the corridor, defended solidly on the back foot
good length and swung in at middle stump. Stabbed towards short leg from the crease
good length and wide outside off. Feet rooted to the crease as he reaches out with hard hands and nearly falls over. It trickles to mid-on
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short and into the ribs. Climbs on top of the bounce and deflects this in front of fine leg off his thigh
full and into the pads. Flicked to fine leg's left and confidently back for the second
short of a length just outside off, some shape away and left alone
good length just outside off, left alone
135kph, good length and some late swing away outside off. Defended on the front foot
good length outside off, poked into the covers on the front foot
full and swinging away outside off, left alone
short of a length on the pads, stabbed to fine leg with the angle
nice line. Marginally outside off on a good length and wobbling. Comes in but he leaves it alone
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length outswinger, wide outside off. Left alone
full outside off, leans in and taps this wide of mid-off
full and shaping away outside off. Leans in and defends to point
short and wide outside off, left alone
good length outside off, nips off the seam and goes away. Left alone
good length and just outside off. Left alone
short of a length and wide outside off. Left alone
good length and wide outside off. Left alone
130kph, length outside off and cuts away sharply. Elgar leaves
good length and just outside off, left alone
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off, blocked solidly on the front foot
short ball lifting in at the thigh. Gets jammed between bat and body as he looks to flick
good length on leg stump, clipped off the pads to fine leg
sticks with that full length, the ball pitches and seams back in, 131 kph. Takes Markram's inside edge, hits him on the body
beauty! It's the other one, 130 kph, full outside off, drawing Markram forward. This one pitches and moves away to beat the bat. No chance for Markram
back of a length outside off, 129 kph, nicely behind the line this time to punch towards point
back of a length, 128 kph, the ball takes the outside half of the bat towards backward point
may have been the slower ball, 132 kph, full and wide outside off. Elgar reaches out and pushes the ball towards mid-off
good leave to end the over. Full and wide outside off, the ball pitches and moves away but Elgar's happy to let this one go and survive the first hour
back of a length outside off, defended to point. 136, nice technique, letting the ball come to him
a tad short, a tad wide. and Markram nails the square cut behind point. Was waiting for a touch of width and Makram just times the ball, perfectly.
a full, wide delivery outside off, left alone
goes full again, a few stumps outside off, 139 kph, left alone
good single. This one swings back in, the one Cummins was setting up Markram for, on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on and he calls well
ooh, excellent delivery. Back of a length, the ball seams away early and keeps leaving Elagr, who also chooses to leave.
slow outside off, 81 kph, some turn immediately. A thick inside edge down to fine leg
slightly leg side-ish, on leg, bunted away towards midwicket. A yes and a no from Elgar.

just over extra cover! That's a bad shot, lots of flight around off, Elgar looks to heave that away over midwicket, against the spin, but the ball spins, takes the outside half and lobs over the fielder, lucky!
flatter trajectory delivery outside off, defended
88 kph, very full around off, Elgar comes forward and drives through mid-on. No man there. Excellent on-drive, very good timing too.
nice end, slower around off, 89 kph, played quietly towards third man
nice line, full around off, 139 kph, a thick outside edge dies down, towards gully.
back of a length around off, 136 kph, some seam movement back in, defended back up the pitch
beauty! 136 kph, good length outside off, the ball seams away just a touch and beat the bat!
picks the length very early, a short one from Cummins. Markram stands tall and pulls to deep square leg for a run
back of a length on off, 139 kph, the ball seams back in. Hits the inside half towards square leg
chipped away past mid-off for three! A full delivery outside off, Elgar may have bunted that, making contact too early but there's three runs. SA have fifty without loss.
slow on middle and leg, 91 kph, worked away against the spin through midwicket
on off, the ball spinning in, 93 kph, worked away to short fine leg
goes shorter, Markram goes right back and pushes to a deep mid-on. Markram reacts late, but well, calling Elgar through for one
92 kph, on middle and leg, smothered back
beauty! Lots of turn, slow through the air, the ball dips, drifts and then rips past the outside edge

and Australia have their first strike! Lyon gets Elgar again! Elgar comes charging down, looking to work the ball away through mid-on, but like in the previous over, the ball spins, takes the leading edge and lobs towards Sayers. He had initially misjudged the ball, but reacted well, went back and took an overhead catch.
on middle and leg, 136 kph, pushed towards mid-on
137 kph, overpitched on middle and leg, driven through mid-on. The fielder dives to his left and stops the ball.
swing! Inswing! 134 kph, on middle and leg, the ball moves back in, Amla is beaten for movement, the ball pings the pad en route to fine leg. An optimistic appeal from Cummins.
excellent line, 139 kph, on off, a thick inside edge to deep square leg
tentative Amla. Just outside off, 137 kph, outside off. Amla withdraws the bat as he is looking to leave, the ball hits that bat towards slip
good stop from gully! Full outside off, moving away. Amla plays tentatively, a thick outside edge dies down towards gully, who dives to his left.
short of a length on leg stump, dabbed in front of short leg off the back foot
short of a length and in at middle stump, defended off the back foot
full on middle stump, driven back down the pitch. Lyon parries it wide of mid-on with a dive
short of a length and spun in at leg stump. Nudged through square leg off the back foot
good length and outside off, solidly blocked on the front foot
shot. Makes sure to get to the pitch of this outside off because he's in big trouble with that gap between bat and pad otherwise. Drills it against the turn and wide of mid-off
good length and big away swing wide outside off. Left alone
length and just outside off, left alone
good length, hint of shape away outside off. Left alone
yorker just outside off, jammed back down the pitch
full and wobbling away in the corridor, left alone
good length at leg stump, nudged to fine leg off the inside half
full on middle stump, driven with the turn to mid-on
short of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length and in at leg stump, dead-batted towards short fine leg

oh yes! Wow. What a treat this guy is. Skips down the track to meet his length ball. He isn't to the pitch but his stride has the turn covered and he stands tall as he launches with the turn, a full face of the bat, and a high elbow over long-on
short of a length and ripping in at middle stump. Jams it into the pitch, between his legs, off the back foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full and some swig outside off. Leans into this, not necessarily a front foot stride, as he caresses it wide of mid-off. Cummins gives chase and whips it back in emphatically to save a run
short of a length outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
good length outside off, left alone
beaten as he looks to defend this outside off. That spits at him from a length and Paine gathers it high
good length outside off, defended on the front foot with soft hands
good length outswinger wide outside off, left alone
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length wide outside off, punched through the covers off the back foot. Simple as you like.
129kph, length and just outside off. Left alone
good length and in the corridor. Dead-batted off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended into the leg side
good length outside off, blocked solidly on the front foot
good length, in at off stump. Defended back down the pitch
short of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length and just outside off. Left alone
short ball at the ribs, gets out of the way and allows it to go past leg stump
good length and just outside off, defended on the front foot
good length and just outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length on the pads and he stands tall to whip this fine on the up
good length just outside off, left alone
good length and just outside off. Looks to lean in to a drive, but this trickles through to mid-off
good length outside off and this dies after going past Amla
good length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg
short of a length at off stump, gets on his toes and drops this into the leg side with soft hands
good length outside off, with movement away off the pitch. Left alone
full on middle stump and it's a well-timed punch to mid-on's right. He gets down quickly and stops it
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
inside edge as Amla nearly gets trapped in front of the stumps. Pushes forward at this length ball and it comes back in a touch
short and wide outside off and this is hammered off the back foot. Straight to sweeper
good length just outside off, tapped to midwicket on the up
back of a length just outside off, punched to mid-on off the back foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
fifty in true Markram style. Stands tall against the length ball and offers the full face to bisect Amla and the stumps at the other end
full and some wobble at an off stump line. Gets the front leg across off stump and pushes it into the leg side
good length and wide outside off. Left alone
good length outswinger outside off, left alone
yorker on leg stump. Jammed into the midwicket region
good length on leg stump, defended on the front foot off the inside half
short ball at middle stump, ducks under it
good length and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
good length on leg stump, nudged to mid-on on the up
good length on off stump, hangs back in the crease and clips this through square leg
good length at off stump, defended on the back foot
good length and straightening in the corridor outside off. Off the outside edge to gully
beaten. Full ball just outside off and he defends inside the line of this as it nips away
good length in the channel, blocked on the front foot.
brushes the front pad as he looks to leave this. That ball slants back in off the pitch but hasn't done enough to be given lbw. Australia won't review
out-of-control slice as he jabs without moving his feet. Full outside off and he's looking to go on the up through cover. Late shape away on that ball
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short ball is too short. He ducks under it comfortably. No comfort for the new captain who leaps high to his left and feels that sting the fingers
bouncer dug in too short again and this time even Paine can't get to it. Sails over him
good length at off stump, inside edge onto pad on the forward defence
good length outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off and with his mid-120s pace, that's too easy for Markram. Punches it well in front of square, through extra cover, from the back foot
full outside off. Looks to punch it on the up and gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
good length with some shape away, left alone
full outside off, driven straight to short extra cover
good length on middle stump, tapped to mid-on on the rise
good length outside off, left alone
bouncer at leg stump, ducks under it
short of a length at off stump, nudged in front of mid-on with soft hands
outside edge falls short of second slip. Shape away from the surface again as he looks to defend at an off stump line. He's playing close to the body with soft hands, so he's safe
good length at off stump, defended on the up
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, leans in and tickles it to fine leg
full outside off, punched back at the bowler from the crease
overpitched outside off and he's through the cover drive early. It dribbles to mid-on off the inside half
good length at middle stump, tapped to midwicket on the up
bouncer, in position to hook but he leaves as this rises up at the last moment
good length outside off, left alone
clips this to square leg
short of a length outside off, left alone
length and into the pads. Poked wide of mid-on
good length at leg stump, deflected into the square leg region off the pad
short of a length outside off, punched to mid-off off the back foot
reverse swing from outside off. Angles in but it's too far wide for a shot
good length on leg stump. Shuffles and flicks to fine leg's right
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full outside off. Leans into drive and gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
good length at off stump, nudged through point with soft hands
full outside off, driven down the pitch off the toe-end
good length outside off, left alone
that has flown past gully! 137 kph, short and wide outside off, Markram goes cutting and the ball flies over the fielder.
back of a length outside off, the ball moving away, 141 kph, defended to mid-off
another good single from Markram. Good length outside off, pushed away towards cover. Mid-off is quick on the ball, but can't prevent one.
a good length delivery outside off, 136 kph, left alone easily.
picks the length early, he knows SA are on top, so he rolls his wrists and attacks. Pulled from top to bottom and racing away through square leg
137 kph, a naughty misfield from mid-on. Full and straight, drilled through mid-on, the fielder dives over the ball. Renshaw has to go chasing from mid-off
on a length, on the pads, worked away through backward square leg
good length outside off, 125 kph, the ball moves away ever so slightly, the kind of ball that will get a good batsman out if he goes chasing. Left alone.
full on middle and leg, 125 kph, pushed to mid-on
too straight, 124 kph, full on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
full outside off, 126 kph, no movement on this occasion. No stroke.
125 kph, full on middle and leg, worked through wide mid-on for a single.
good length on off, Hazlewood goes wide of the crease, Amla looks to work the ball through square leg, the ball holds its line. Defended
good length outside off, 142 kph, left alone. This is a probing spell from Hazlewood, to Amla.
back of a length outside off, extra bounce, 139 kph, Amla is right on top of the bounce to defend
138 kph, Markram sends Amla back, rightly! Back of a length on middle and leg, nudged towards short leg. Amla takes a few steps forward, then is sent back as the bowler is quick on it.
digs this in but too short, tennis-ball bouncer over Amla
wide of the crease, full and wide outside off, left alone
some flight around off, 88 kph, driven back to the bowler
slow outside off, some drift, off the outside half towards point
shortish around off, 93 kph, Markram is right behind the line.
on the pads, he waits and works the ball to deep midwicket for one
too quick, short and fast, nudged into Handscomb's body at short leg, the spot vacated by Bancroft
83 kph, nice, tidy line and Amla is behind to block
excellent bowling, using the width of the crease very well. Good length, the ball pitches and seams away, leaving Markram flirting, beats the outside edge.
goes fuller, 143 kph, around off, blocked
full and straight, 142 kph, was waiting for that, worked away through backward square leg for a couple
nailed that! Goes short does Hazlewood, Markram reads the length quickly, sways on the pull and finds the gap through backward square leg with ease.
too straight, worked away down to fine leg, 137 kph.
overpitched outside off, inviting the drive but Amla says not yet with a leave
lovely use of the feet, runs down, meets the flight early, converts to a full toss and slices the drive through cover for two
on the pads, quick, nudged away into the leg side
slow on middle and off, spin, played to midwicket
well bowled, shortens the length on leg, forces a good defensive stroke from Markram
and again, quick on middle and leg, nudged to short leg
lots of flight on middle and leg, 85 kph, driven away with the turn to long-on for a run.
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full on middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket
full on middle stump. Leans in and flicks straight to midwicket
good length on middle stump, brings the bat down late on this. Gets it to deep square off the inside edge
good length and in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
good length outside off, squirms off the thick outside edge as he defends on the front foot
good length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, steps out out and drives back at the bowler
back of a length at middle stump, backs into the leg side and nudges this through cover off the back foot
good length on leg stump. Defended to short leg from the crease
short of a length and pushed through flat at a middle stump line. He's forced to dead-bat it after shaping to punch through cover
length on leg stump, steps out and flicks it to deep backward square
full outside off, leans in and punches through extra cover
full outside off, tapped to mid-off on the up
short of a length outside off, steers it wide of gully with an open face

140kph, outswing, edge and a sensational flying catch by Handscomb at second slip. Length ball swings away late as Amla looks to crash through the line on the up. No feet from him. It's a thick edge and he looks like he might get away with it, but Handscomb takes a quick step to his right and leaps to take it two-handed, followed by a tumble
full at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and straight through outside off stump, left alone
full on leg stump, poked into the leg side off the front foot
short of a length at leg stump, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
full at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length on leg stump, pushed to short leg off the front foot
length and down leg side. Markram stands his ground and pokes at it but can't get bat on the flick. Paine can't gather either
back of a length on leg stump, clipped to deep square off the back foot
beaten. Spits up from a length and Markram is caught playing an ordinary shot, with his bat hanging well away from the body
good length and some late swing away from off stump. But he's behind this nicely with the front foot push and merely nudges it through cover
short of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off and he mistimes the cover drive. Looking to belt this off the front foot but he's tried to hit it too hard and lost control. It bounces back to the bowler
lift-off! Big, big lift from a length outside off. De Villiers is ready for a punch on the up through cover and it flies past his handle
length outside off, left alone
shot. Against the turn, drilled between mid-off and extra cover. Lyon's hit a good length on a middle stump line but he jumps down the track and goes inside-out
short of a length at leg stump, glanced straight to short leg on the bounce
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
short of a length on leg stump, tickled to deep midwicket off the back foot
back of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
short of a length on leg stump, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length outside off, left alone
length ball outside off and one again, he can't time the drive. This time he's through it early. It pings through midwicket off the inside edge
146kph, full outside off, blocked solidly on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the inside half
full outside off, driven straight back at the bowler
good length on off stump, solidly defended on the front foot

leaps and punches the air with his right hand after nudging this length ball through square leg for his fourth Test century. What a start to his career and what a truly top-class player this guy is. Flawless today.
good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
tossed up on leg stump, driven straight to short midwicket
short of a length just outside off, backs away and slices through point
good length on leg stump, blocked on the front foot
full outswinger, too far wide outside off to draw a stroke
short and wide outside off, left alone
short ball in at leg stump. Looks to pummel this behind square with a short-arm pull but cops it on the thigh guard
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
short and wide sucker ball outside off, he leaves it
a nervous prod outside off on the front foot. Steers it to gully off the toe-end
floated up on off stump and he drives straight to extra cover
short of a length at leg stump, pushed to short midwicket off the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, flicked onto short leg off the back foot
length ball on leg stump, glanced to deep backward square

big lbw appeal as AB is struck in front of the stumps as he looks to flick. This will probably come down to whether it pitched in line. Remember, Lyon is bowling around the wicket. Paine has a chat and reviews it. It did appear to turn a long way too, so maybe just going on where it pitched won't be enough...yeah. It's pitched in line but it will spin well down leg side. Australia lose the review.
good length on middle stump, driven between the bowler and short midwicket, who collide as they go after this. They barge into each other knees-first
full and just outside off. Mistimed drive back down the pitch
full and just outside off. Jammed towards mid-on off the front foot

is there an edge? Looks like it, but it doesn't seem to have carried. Paine takes it but says he isn't sure. He asks Ian Gould at square leg. Nigel Llong straight away points to the ground to say it's pitched in front of the keeper...but then he goes for the third umpire with a soft signal for not-out. Bit strange that. It's a thin edge as Markram pushes onto the front foot against a length ball that straightens. That's died on the way to the keeper and replays confirm it bounced in front of the keeper
short of a length just outside off, and this time it carries through as he leaves alone
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length and just outside off, defended on the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, driven to long-on off the front foot
good length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot

in the air and just evades deep midwicket! He has the tendency to hit long-hops down that fielder's throat. Never looking to keep his down. It's a short ball on leg stump and he gets it off the toe end. Drags it wide of Khawaja, to his left
length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
good length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
good length and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off. Dropped in front of cover with soft hands
good length outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper's left off the back foot
good length outside off, flowing drive on the up to sweeper's right this time
full and wide outswinger outside off. Can't get him to go after this
full on middle stump, flicked into the leg side
length on middle stump, defended into the leg side
length on leg stump, blocked off the front foot
full at leg stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
back of a length on middle stump, dead-batted into the pitch
short of a length just outside off, nudged through cover off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full and just outside off, left alone
good length on leg stump, flicked wide of mid-on

carved away to the point boundary. A deliberate step back to move his weight in that direction and then he throws his hands at this wide length ball outside off. Uses his wrists to get it wide of the sweeper fielder
good length on off stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
short and wide outside off, slapped on the up to sweeper
short of a length outside off, tapped to sweeper off the back foot
short of a length outside off, sliced to sweeper's left off the back foot
short of a length outside off, dabbed wide of gully off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, angled in to him. He blocks it into the leg side on the front foot
good length outside off, defended off the outside half on the front foot
mistimed pull wide of mid-on. Gets underneath this a tad too much and ends up slicing it. He's on the back foot too early and this sits in the pitch as he pulls out the shot
short ball outside off and this one is well-timed. Allows it to come on and plays a late cut to sweeper's left. That's another fifty-run stand, the third of the innings
good length and angled in at off stump. Inside edge onto back leg as he looks to defend on the front foot. There's some swing inwards on that one
short ball outside off, left alone
full on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
length on leg stump, nudged to fine leg's left from the crease
short ball outside off, allows it to come and opens the face at the last moment to send this rolling towards the deep backward point boundary
length and into the pads. He allows it to come on and deflects it behind square off the thigh guard
is that dropped? Nah, it isn't. Swings in and cuts past the inside edge as he pushes on the front foot.
length outside off and he chips without control towards mid-off. Little antsy now, AB. Feet nowhere near the pitch of that
good length outside off, blocked on the front foot

crashed away. Hazlewood is a touch short outside off and there's plenty of room to free his arms. The feet - well, they've been moving well anyway. Weight promptly shifted to the back foot and he sends this past point
good length and in at middle stump. Squares him up and he defends down the pitch

in the air and past the bowler. Looks to drive on the up and this pitch still isn't showing signs of that being a good option. It's a tad outside off and he drives firmly, probably for the best. Mid-off cleans up
good length outside off, some shape in. Leans in nicely and gets close to the ball with the stride as he drives to extra cover
good length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
loud appeal for caught-behind. Not out, says Ian Gould. That's a strange shot. The ball is slanting into the corridor from short of a length as he looks to arch backwards and steer this past slip
length just outside off, punched on the up to mid-off
tentative. Not having a great time right now, AB. Anxious push on the front foot to defend off the inside half
length just outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, tickled into the leg side off the back foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
low full toss on leg stump, flicked straight to short midwicket
good length and a hint of shape into the corridor. Left alone
beaten. Late outswing again from Cummins, like when he got Amla. Full and wide ball and it's loose from Markram, chasing well away from the body
outswing again. At a good length. He lets it go
good length just outside off, blocked on the front foot

close! So close! Not out says Nigel Llong. This has thudded him on the pads right in front of off stump after cutting back in. Paine reviews. It pitches on off stump, hits and cuts in from a length. But it also appears to be one of those that has climbed steeply....yes it has! Wow, that is an incredible decision from Llong. It's going over the stumps and that's the last review gone. Superb umpiring, because that looked dead.
good length just outside off, defended into the off side, one-handed off the outside edge
thuds into the pad from a length. Inside edge on the way too. AB is rooted to the crease and stabbing at this incoming ball well in front of his body
length ball angling in and jumping up in the corridor. Left alone
nicely played. Length ball slanted in at off and this time he's in full balance. Short stride and he punches it past the non-striker with the full face
full outswinger outside off, left alone
good length ball shaping away, left alone
yorker at leg stump and he barely manages to get the bat on this. Manages to keep it out
shape away in the corridor, but this is deftly pushed off the back foot to find two at deep point
good length and swing away again. Leans in and punches this past extra cover
good length and angled in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
short ball down leg side and he can't get bat on the pull
squeezes it past mid-on where Hazlewood can't get down quickly enough to his right. It's an overpitched ball on leg stump and he clips it neatly off the inside half
full and wide, swinging further away after pitching. De Villiers isn't fooled, a leave
excellent line, he's troubling AB. Good length outside off, a watchful block
goes for the drive but he's beaten! Excellent bowling, 123 kph, full outside off, eliciting the drive. AB says yes, but some away movement beats the bat.
full outside off, 124 kph, left alone.
overpitched outside off, 123 kph, AB comes forward and blocks.
another maiden from Sayers. He's doing a very good job, full on middle and off, right behind the line is de Villiers.
a good length delivery outside off, 138 kph, Markram opens the bat face and guides the ball to gully.
some more seam movement but it's a tad short. Outside off, Markram glides the ball to point.
strays on the pads and de Villiers works him away through backward square leg for two
overpitched outside off, a good leave from AB, 141 kph. Not bothered by his stalling innings
wide of the crease goes Cummins, on a length outside off, left alone again
good leaves, 138 kph, outside off, left alone easily

poor start. A delivery that is well down the leg side, just nudged down towards fine leg for three. Cummins runs across from fine leg and somehow get there, one ball after his own over. He is bleeding now, something may have scraped his arm. Sensational effort
lots of flight on middle, worked to midwicket
a bit of width this time, AB goes back and carves a cut through point for two. Was waiting for that
81 kph, slow on middle and leg, clipped to short leg
the powerful sweep to deep backward square leg. Lyon drifts again and AB pummels his sweep
comes charging down and gets too close to it, drills the shot right back. Lyon half-stops the ball, but can't prevent one.
on middle and leg, 138 kph, worked away to midwicket from the crease.
a good length delivery outside off, pushed away to mid-on from the crease
lovely batting! A tad overpitched and Markram leans into a drive through deep cover, two more. He now has his highest Test score
digs this one in, short down leg, helped along to fine leg for a run
back of a length outside off, the ball moving back in, pushed to cover
a good length delivery outside off, left alone again
flat outside off, the ball spinning in, nudged down to fine leg for a run
walks right across, gets outside the line and nails his sweep to deep backward square leg. Cummins did not see the ball, puts his hands up before running to his left. It's gone
this is even better, he saw backward square leg move squarer, so he gets low and just paddles this fine to the fine leg boundary. Deft touch. This is AB, at his best in Tests
short down leg, off the leading edge towards silly point
pulled for six to the deep backward square leg boundary! A short delivery down leg, AB goes back and top-edges that into the Highveld air, well over
slow around off, 89 kph, defended
a yorker outside off, 140 kph, moving away. Markram can't connect with a block.

back of a length outside off, Markram stands tall and punches the ball through cover with delectable ease. Renshaw runs around to his right, and saves one. Australia have saved two runs now in three overs, lovely
through mid-off and that will be Markram's first 150 of his Test career! Can I say that won't be his last? I'm going to say it. Full and wide, drilled through cover for four. Just leant on that shot.
138 kph, full and wide outside off, left alone

the second time he has got out like that after a sensational hundred in the series! Back of a length outside off, Markram goes back, and carves a dab to gully. Not quite in control of that shot. It was a back of a length, moving away, and he chose to dab it fine. He has been scoring with that shot right through the series, a good low catch from gully.

he leaves an inducker and Faf leaves! Struck outside off, and the umpire Llong's decision comes even before the appeal. It was full and swinging back in prodigiously. Faf left, then saw that movement, tried to bring his bat down but his body twirled into a half-duck instead, that's how his instinct took over. He chats with AB, but no review. That looked out.
90 kph, outside off, worked to deep midwicket for a run.
short outside off, Bavuma walks across and works this to fine leg to open his account.
89 kph, driven with the spin to long-on for a single
short outside off, 89 kph, Bavuma goes back and punches to mid-on
drifts on the pads, nudged to short fine leg, 88 kph
quick on the pads, clipped to midwicket
smiles all around! 138 kph, a good length delivery outside off. AB is lulled into playing because of what he saw with Faf. But the ball pitches and seams the other way to beat the bat.
too full, on off, 138 kph, blocked
a full delivery outside off, tapped towards deep point for one. Don't think Cummins will be too unhappy.
close to off, on a length, 134 kph, blocked away
overpitched, Bavuma gets forward and drives through cover for a couple. Renshaw digs his knee into the turf
good leave! Full and wide outside off, Bavuma lifts his hands and lets that go, moving back in, close to the off stump.
some flight outside off, nudged away to midwicket
short outside off, spinning back in, off the pad towards short fine leg.
smashed into the gap at deep backward square leg for four more. Gets right across and nails the hard sweep, just past short leg.
slow around off, 88 kph, inside-edged down to fine leg
shimmies down and pushes the ball to long-on. So easy.
good single. On middle and leg, clipped to mid-on. Bavuma calls AB, AB responds late.
past mid-off, four. Full and wide, gentle medium pace. Bavuma gets forward and caresses a drive through extra cover.
good length outside off, left alone
strays on the pads, 126 kph, nudged down to fine leg for one
short, wide and smashes! Back of a length outside off, AB rocks back and nails his cut to the deep cover boundary. He's onto 49 now. His strike rate well over 50
full and straight, 129 kph, defended
de Villiers' fifty, off just 94 balls! And he has been struggling for most of his innings. What a player. On a length, nudged to square leg.
good length and ripping into leg stump. Pushes deep and nudges this wide of short fine
length ball outside off, spinning into the thigh as he looks to flick
short of a length and spun into the hips. Glances straight to short fine
length ball bounces into the thigh again. Deflected towards short fine
good length on middle stump, flicked straight to short midwicket
length ball at middle stump. Steps out and is beaten in flight but he manages to poke this wide of midwicket
short of a length wide outside off, left alone
good length on the pads, tapped wide of mid-on on the up
good length and late swing away from the corridor. Defended into the covers
oh shot. No room on that short of a length ball in the corridor, but he has skipped off the pitch, opened it up with an arch and sliced this to gully's right
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full toss down leg side and he tickles it fine, no fuss
tossed up at middle stump, driven straight to mid-on
short of a length at leg stump, whipped through deep midwicket off the back foot
good length outside off, defended off the front foot
length on off stump, pushed through flat. Rides the bounce and dabs it in front of short fine
tossed up at off stump, flicked to short midwicket
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
jumps in from outside off as he leaves, but it's climbed a long way
full toss at off stump, tapped to mid-off's left
tossed up outside off, driven to extra cover's left
floated up outside off, leans in and drives to extra cover
full toss on off stump and he still can't beat mid-off to his left
good length on leg stump, flicked in front of short fine off the front foot
length ball spitting up at middle stump, slides into the off side off the leading edge as he defends on the front foot
full on middle stump, flicked to deep square
oh good shot. Lovely stride forward to cut out the spin and then he gently drives this wide of mid-off
short ball down leg side, pulled uppishly to deep square
tossed up at off stump, defended on the front foot
dropped short on leg stump, swivels and pulls  to deep square
short of a length and swinging away outside off. Left alone
short of a length with shape away, but too wide once again. Left alone
full toss swinging away outside off. Short backlift tap from de Villiers, past the non-striker. Mid-on pushes it away with the momentum from his slide to the left
141kph, good length and shaping away outside off. Left alone and collected at head height
probing. Late outswing in the channel outside off. He lets it go on the front foot
good length outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length at middle stump and whipped off the back foot to deep square's left
119kph, full outswinger outside off, left alone
121kph, full and wobbling just outside off. Jabbed to mid-on off the inside half
good length, swinging away outside off, left alone
full outswinger outside off. Driven back to the bowler on the up
short ball in the corridor, mistimed pull into the turf to midwicket
short of a length just outside off, dead-batted towards gully
short and wide outside off, cut straight to deep point
short of a length in the corridor, some tail away. Defended solidly on the back foot
good length and hooping away outside off. Left alone
good length and in at off stump. Looks to drive on the up and is probably saved by how steeply this ball bounces. Catches him on the sticker and dies
inside edge as he looks to nudge at this with hard hands outside off. Loose shot, falls between is legs

has he got him? He has, according to the umpire. AB de Villiers reviews straight away. A loopy inswinger that AB has not picked at all. He's looking to belt this on the up through cover with a massive gap between bat and pad. It's a very faint edge if there is indeed one there...and there is! Sayers' first Test wicket is AB de Villiers. That's an indipper, seam pointing inwards that zips off a length and narrowly misses off stump on it's way to the keeper. The snicko shows a faint disturbance as it passes the bat
short of a length in the corridor, left alone

got him! Chips it straight to mid-off. Sayers mayhem! Stunning seam presentation again. Length ball shaping in at off stump. He isn't to the pitch and prods at it with hard hands. Mid-off leaps to his left and completes a simply take
good length and slanted across off stump. Watchfully defended into the off side
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
beats the outside edge with one that jumps away in the corridor. Bavuma looking to defend this on the back foot
full and wide outside off, left alone
length and swung away outside off, left alone

goes wide of the crease and gets this to swing away from off stump. Watchfully pushed into the covers on the front foot and a slight misunderstanding between the batsmen. QDK not too keen on the run, but he complies in the end
length in the corridor, left alone
shot. Hazlewood drops this short and angles it across the batsman. He gets on top of the bounce and taps it through cover point
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, left alone
good length on leg stump, flicked through square leg. Fine leg cleans up
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full outswinger at off stump, tapped back to the bowler
good length outside off, defended to gully on the front foot
full and drifted down leg side. A nervous attempt at a paddle sweep from QDK. Runs fine off his boot. Lbw appeal's turned down, that pitched outside
tossed up outside off, nudges it to mid-off off the front foot
good length outside off, gets down quickly and sweeps. Gets a top edge that goes fine of deep square leg
full outside off, driven straight to mid-off
good length outside off, poked back to the bowler off the front foot
good length on middle stump, flicked to short midwicket's left and he dives to stop
good length just outside off, defended to gully off the outside half
dropped short and pushed wide. He stands tall and spanks this to the point boundary
length ball outside off and he shuffles across to defend down the pitch
length and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, defended to point off the back foot
short ball outside off, cut on the bounce to Lyon at point whose faux-celebration doesn't fool the crowd. Nice try.
short of a length outside off, left alone

jumps at Bavuma and lobs off his back glove. It lands short of Paine. This is short of a length and it rises steeply to hit Bavuma, whose leaving technique is fine - bat's well out the way and moving behind his body - but won't prevent the impact
length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
length ball down leg side and he tickles it fine off the pads
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
good length and just outside off, solidly blocked on the front foot
good length outside off, left alone
short of a length on leg stump, nudged through square leg off the back foot with soft hands
good length and slanted across off stump, left alone
full and some swing in at leg stump. Tapped to mid-on on the up
short and just outside off. Rising up and he leaves
bangs it in at good length in the corridor, straightens after the angle in and beats the outside edge
short of a length outside off, left alone
short ball climbing up wide outside off. Shapes to cut and leaves
good length and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
falls short of Khawaja at short extra cover. A drive on the up against an outswinger. The bounce is bothering him here
good length and slanted across off stump, left alone
good length with a hint of late swing in. Driven on the up to mid-off
good length on middle stump, punched to mid-on on the rise
good length, wide outside off. Throws his hands at it and drives aerially but wide of short extra. It trickles to sweeper's left
good length and just outside off. Left alone
short and just outside off. Chopped to the sweeper
short of a length across the corridor, left alone
climbs over the stumps after nipping in off the surface. QDK was looking to leave this on angle
full and just outside off. Driven on the up to extra cover
good length inswinger at middle stump. Punched on the up to mid-on
another bouncer that Paine can't stop. It's a spongy pitch, you don't have to do much to get the ball up. Cummins digs this in too short and it sails over the keeper
short ball slanted across the corridor, left alone
short ball outside off, cut to deep point
full on leg stump, jabbed to mid-on off the front foot
good length on off stump, punched to mid-on's right and his slide is on the lazier side. He can't stop cleanly
good length and swinging away outside off. Left alone
beaten on the outside edge and then safe on the stumping. Falls over a touch into the off side after this outswinger skids past his outside edge
good length and in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
short of a length in the corridor and cutting in towards off stump. But he leaves confidently on height
short of a length just outside off. Tapped to extra cover off the back foot
full with some late swing inwards. He just manages to bring the bat down and squeeze this past mid-on off the inside half
good length and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length and another one hits the glove. Cummins is making it climb. This one comes in at the chest and he's forced to fend at it
short of a length in the corridor, left alone
good length ball outside off, mistimed drive on the up into the off side
good length and just outside off. Defended on the front foot
full and wobbling at an off stump line. Looks to drive straight but this fizzes off the outside half to point
short of a length just outside off, defended on the back foot
good length and just outside off. Defended into the leg side on the front foot
good length outswinger outside off, left alone
good length just outside off, jagging back in off the seam. He's expecting that to go away with the trajectory. Close to the off stump in the end
length ball on middle stump, punched firmly on the up but Cummins won't let it past at mid-on
good length on middle stump, punched to mid-on's left to steal the single
outside edge well short of second slip. Looks to jab at this on the front foot but he's gone with soft hands
short ball climbing high outside off. Left alone
full outswinger outside off, left alone
good length outside off, inside edge onto pad as he pushes on the front foot
full and just outside off. Dragged to mid-on off the front foot
cuts past the outside edge. Big movement off the pitch there after drawing him in on the front foot
oh close. Narrowly misses off stump. QDK plays inside the line on the forward defence and this lifts over the off stump and runs away off Paine's right thumb
full outside off, driven firmly to mid-off's left. Renshaw picks up to his left and puts in a comical left-handed throw
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, left alone
overpitched and in at leg stump. No one stopping this - it's drilled past the non-striker. Full face, high elbow
oh lovely. Length ball outside off and he leans in superbly to get close to it and punch on the up to get it between mid-off and extra cover. Outfield looks damp, Renshaw pulls it back
raps the pad but there might be an inside edge there. Certainly going over too. Bavuma done by the skid into him as he looks to defend on the front foot
good length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, driven straight to mid-on
short of a length outside off, left alone
dipping onto a good length at off stump. Defended uppishly into the off side
another loopy length ball at off stump. Steps out and closes the face on it to get a leading edge into the off side
short and skidding outside off, chopped to backward point
length on off stump, steps out and flicks to mid-on's left
short of a length and spinning down leg. Can't get bat on the glance
good length outside off, defended on the front foot off the inside edge
good length on off stump. Pushed through backward point off the thick outside edge
good length and in at off stump, punched back at the bowler on the up
short ball just outside off, arches backwards and leaves
what a ball. Angled into the corridor at a length and drawing him in for a drive on the up. But it explodes off the surface and goes past the outside edge
good length at off stump, punched straight to mid-off
fends aerially but he's done it deftly enough for it to land short of gully. Short ball in the corridor gets big on him
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot

past the outside edge and lobbed wide of the slip fielder off the keeper. There's a sound as this goes through, did he edge it? Unclear right now, but this ball drifts, pitches on middle and then rips away with bounce. Slight disturbance on Ultra Edge as it goes past the glove...
length on off stump, defended to point off the front foot
length on off stump to beat the outside edge on the forward defence
genius shot. Short of a length and spinning away sharply outside off but he goes on the back foot and punches against the turn through the vacant midwicket region
floated up at a length outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, left alone

we'll give you one say Cummins and Khawaja. He punches a length ball to mid-on, from where Cummins takes a dig at the non-striker's end. Khawaja doesn't expect the throw at extra cover and can only parry it to sweeper
good length and slanted across off stump, left alone
short ball down leg side, left alone

this is close! Oh did it pitch outside? Llong says not out after QDK misses a flick. It looked plumb on line, there's no question - raps the back leg right in front of middle stump. Australia have no reviews left...ah but replays say it's another good decision from Llong. It's pitching outside leg. He's had a great Test so far
length on middle stump, dragged to mid-on off the front foot
back of a length and in at leg stump, nudged to short fine's left
short of a length outside off, steered wide of slip with the turn off the back foot
short of a length at leg stump, nudged to short fine
tossed up outside off, driven against the turn to mid-off
short of a length at leg stump again. Pushed uppishly to square leg
...so he sweeps. It's a full ball on middle and he swats it forcefully to deep square's right. Can't beat his dive to the right though
well played. He's waited and waited and he gets an overpitched ball outside off. Leans in, opens the face at the last moment and squeezes this past point
bouncer at middle stump, gets under it to leave
full on off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
well bowled. in an alternate dimension, Hazlewood has a five-for in this Test. Marginal cut away in the corridor and he can't find the edge as Bavuma walks all over this
short ball outside off, left alone
length ball on leg stump, dropped in front of mid-on with soft hands and despite an acrobatic backhand flick on the turn, the fielder can't stop the run
good length at off stump, bouncing and turning into the inside half as he goes forward for the defence
steps out and blocks with the body. That backward short leg has already had an effect. Short of a length ball and he has premeditated stepping down to it. Forced to stop with his thigh as it turns
short of a length on middle stump and he can easily get onto the back foot to punch to deep square
good length outside off, blocked off the front foot
length on middle stump and easy to get down to at 91kph. He skips out and flicks through midwicket
good length at off stump, blocked on the front foot...and he nearly falls over after..
pushes uppishly to extra cover. Feet planted in the crease as he goes after this full ball outside off
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length on off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
beats the outside edge. That's lifting up too much for him to execute the cover drive on the up
full ball fired down leg side and he does what's needed - gets a bit of bat on it. Runs away fine
short of a length outside off, left alone with a withdrawn bat
big turn. Too much to get the edge. Draws him forward on off stump, spins it past the bat
nearly chops it on. Length ball skids through straight and gets the inside edge as he looks to cut off the front foot
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler off the front foot
past the edge again. This one is short of a length at off stump. Shoot away outside off
taken at gully but that's off the thigh guard. He's looking to play the paddle sweep against this bouncy length ball at off stump
length on off stump, not to the pitch as he drives. Rolls into the off side off the outside half
inside the line as this straightens in the corridor, beaten
full on off stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot

oh boy! What a shot! The bounce hasn't been in his favour so he decides to get under it and take control. Length ball outside off, reaches out with open arms and makes no effort to keep this drive down. Gets it over extra cover with full control
off the leading edge and past gully. It's back to being troubled by the bounce. This lifts off a length and moves towards the slip cordon as he looks to whip it across the line through midwicket
length ball at leg stump, inside edge dribbles behind square off the pad as he looks to flick
full on off stump, tapped to mid-on off the toe-end
tossed up outside off, jumps down the track and meets it on the full before expertly squeezing this through cover with an open face. Mighty applause as he raises his bat for a well-crafted fifty
spanked. No one behind square on the leg side, so QDK shuffles, gets down for the inevitable length ball on off stump and sweeps uppishly to the backward square boundary
good length on middle stump, pushed to mid-on against the turn
flat and fast at a length outside off. Skids past the outside edge as he looks to chop this through point
steps out and meets it on the full again. Clips it through the open midwicket region from well outside off

poor shot against the turn and it's a simple one for mid-on. Short of a length at off and spinning and bouncing away from him outside off. More bounce than the one he whipped through midwicket off the back foot not so long ago. This time he's cramped on the same shot and the top edge lobs harmlessly for the fielder
good length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
nicely directed bouncer has the batsman on the floor. Nasty one, slanting in at the helmet. He does well to keep his eyes on this and sway out of the way
beats the outside edge. Bounce from a good length again and he defends inside the line
short at off stump, defended off the back foot
now beaten on the front foot. Late movement away outside off as he looks to play the cover drive
nice. Uses the bounce to his advantage again. Short ball outside off, arches backwards and lifts this over the point region with a late uppercut
good length at middle stump, dead-batted into the leg side off the back foot
falls short of backward short leg as he defends from the crease. This spits up from a length and takes the inside edge
wide of forward short leg as he looks to push this away with hard hands. Confused feet from Philander
length on middle stump, goes deep in the crease and tickles it fine to give deep square some work
past backward short as he flicks with hard hands. Not on top of the bounce for this middle stump ball
tossed up at middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket
hangs the bat out, misses the ball. You know how it goes...
leaves one alone and gets stung on the thigh. Faf du Plessis style misjudgement, but this is a short of a length ball and he escapes with a bruise
good length outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
sliced over cover as he looks to go inside-out over extra. Not to the pitch of this
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
looks to launch this over midwicket, but he's not to the pitch. Ends up dragging it wide of deep square from short of a length
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length and spinning down leg side. Can' get bat on the glance
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
creamed. Overpitched outside off, nice pace at 92kph, and he plants the front leg out to send this wide of mid-off
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, pokes in front of the body with hard hands to try and squeeze this wide of cover. Gets a thick inside edge to deep square's left and the home crowd love it - that's 400 up
past the outside edge. Looks to defend wide outside off and can't get close
good length on off stump, defended off the front foot
short of a length, back foot defence, except not, it's with the keeper via the airspace next to the outside edgr
keeps low and still beats the outside edge, along with off stump. This skids on in the corridor as he looks to defend on the front foot
length outside off, left alone
sharp turn back in, beats the bat as he looks to tickle. Good take down leg by Paine. Stifled appeal but the umpire was dead sure there was nothing.
cracking stroke! Too short, little bit of width too, and Philander rocks back to crash this past the diving Shaun Marsh at backward point
spins back into middle and leg, worked with the spin to deep midwicket
lunges forward and defends with the spin to the leg side
flatter and fuller on the stumps, some overspin on that one, defended back

dropped! Straight in and straight out of Burns' hands at backward short leg. Bavuma turned this firmly with the spin but couldn't keep it down. Burns juggled twice but couldn't hold on as he was off balance.
full on off stump, he lunges forward and defends to the off side
gets half-forward and eases this full delivery to short mid-off
gets this to curve away a touch from outside off, pushed to mid-off.
floats this full outside off again, Philander shows the full face of the bat in defense
short of length delivery outside off, gets this to nip away off the seam, left alone.
gets a slight stride forward and defends into the off side.
gets outside the line of the stumps and sweeps it down to deep fine leg
goes back and across to defend a fullish delivery on off stump
gets half a stride forward and keeps out this full delivery on off stump
has he got some bat? No. LBW? No. Gould not interested. This was fired into the stumps, gets it to bite off the deck. Philander looks to defend but is beaten on the inside edge
touch full on the stumps again, he gets across and defends.
defended from the crease into the leg side
beauty from Sayers. Gets this to curve away late to beat Bavuma's forward defense. The back foot was dragged out of the crease briefly
opens the face of the bat to steer this length delivery to gully
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends to the off side
turns this short of length delivery from middle to midwicket
gets this to bounce off the deck from length, Bavuma chops this and the ball lodges inside his pads.
just eludes the diving gully fielder. Races away. Bavuma wasn't in control, loose drive outside off. Went hard with an opened bat face, the bottom hand came off as well. Lucky to get away
turned with the spin to short leg
turns this wide of short leg as they amble through for a single
chips down the track and turns this fastish delivery to short midwicket
gets right on top of the bounce and turns this towards deep square leg
right to the pitch of the ball as he drives to short cover
slow turn into middle and leg, defended.
full and swinging away from off stump, Bavuma gets a thick inside edge to the leg side. Played down the wrong line
gets this to curve away from off stump, left alone
curves one away from off stump, left alone
slides this length delivery into middle and leg, turned to midwicket
gets a good stride forward and defends with soft hands
gets outside the line of the stumps and blocks this full delivery again
sharp turn from outside off, defended back
bite and bounce from the deck, Philander goes back and across as he defends
gets a thick inside edge, lobs wide of short leg! Played down the wrong line
fired full on the stumps, Philander goes back into the crease and blocks
steps out and hoicks this straight down the throat of Khawaja at deep midwicket. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball and ended up dragging it from outside off. Ended up hitting it a lot squarer.
goes back and manages to turn this towards fine leg. Uppish, but safe
squeezed towards point for an easy single
full and tailing away late from off stump, squirted back to the bowler
digs one in short, but this is way outside off, Maharaj sways out of the way
drives and misses. Went hard at that, no feet movement at all. Beaten by the late outswing
just short of gully! Mitch Marsh the fielder there. This time the inswinger, Maharaj look to work this to the leg side, lobbed off the shoulder of the bat
squeezed into the gap between gully and backward point, excellent running
big sweep, big miss. Looked to fetch it from way outside off, hit on the right thigh
once again misses the line completely. Looked to sweep from way outside off, Paine couldn't collect it cleanly. One more to the kitty
uppish but this lobs wide of short leg. This was a thick inside edge as he looked to work this to square leg
shapes to drive but is beaten by the drift, gets a thick inside edge to short midwicket
works this length ball to short leg
touch full and just outside off, left alone
crunching cover drive. Saw this full outside off, he got to the pitch and thumped it away.
goes back into the crease and defends this full delivery to the off side
full and shaping away from outside off, left alone
right on top of the bounce as he defends to cover
slash and a miss. There was too much width on that one, he went too hard at it but couldn't lay bat as he played a fraction late
steps out and works this with the spin to midwicket
whipped with the spin to deep square leg
lobbed towards long on off a thick inside edge. Looked to go over cover but was playing against the turn
steps out and works this full delivery to short leg, good stop by Burns
lobs off the thigh pad to short leg. Done in by the bounce
steps out to drive, doesn't get to the pitch of the ball. Nearly chipped it back
full on off from wide of the crease, squeezed back to the bowler
gets big on him as he looks to fetch the pull from outside off, beaten.
works this with the angle into the leg side. Got this to move back in
thick outside edge but doesn't carry to the cordon.
magnificent. That has really woken me up. This was banged in short, he picked the length early and swatted that away in front of square to the midwicket boundary. So good to watch
turns this gently into the leg side, Lyon gets this to bounce extra from the tough
lunges forward and dabs this wide of cover for a quick single
worked past the bowler to long-on
whips this from middle to deep square leg

delightful sweep shot. Everything right. Got well outside the line, down on one knee, over the delivery, rolled his wrists nicely and controlled this superbly. Raced to the deep backward square leg fence
goes back and across as he bunts this to short midwicket
defends this length ball back
nearly sneaked through. Played outside the line, thick inside edge down to deep square leg
nice balance as he works this incoming length ball to deep square leg
looks to arch back and help this short delivery over third man, beaten though.
right to the pitch of the ball as he squirts this full delivery to point
defends this full delivery from the crease to cover
drifts away a full delivery across the right-hander from around the stumps, defended
turned with the spin to midwicket
steps out and drags this lofted hit into the leg side, but picks the gap at deep midwicket. Khawaja gets a bad bounce so he can't pull it back in
driven firmly but straight to mid-off
goes back and across as he works this shortish delivery to midwicket
short of length on middle, defended back
gets this length ball to move away just a touch from off stump, defended.
tails in to hit him on the pad as he shapes to work this into the leg side, rolls off the pad to the leg side, quick single
full and straight on off stump from wide of the crease, defended with soft hands
right on top of the bounce as he defends this length ball.
pushes forward, squirts to square leg off an inside edge
steps out but can't get to the pitch, blocked with the pad
top shot. Too short, he rocks back and slaps this cut to the point boundary
right on top of the bounce as he turns it to the leg side
hoicked into the stands at deep midwicket. The good thing about the stroke was he was playing it with the spin. Danced down the pitch, didn't get to the pitch but gave it a good whack
backs away and slaps this length delivery to the extra cover boundary
shapes to defend but bails out in the end
gets a good stride forward and defends this full delivery into the off side
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends
hit on the right thigh as he looks to whip this behind square.
full and just outside off, Bavuma lunges forward and drives to cover
helps this short ball down to fine leg for an easy single
full and flat on the stumps, defended back
turns this down to long-on
sharp turn back in from outside off, beats the tickle, well taken down leg
sharp turn from middle, tickled towards fine leg
nice roll of the wrists as he works this to deep square leg

looks to flay this through point but ends up getting a thick outside edge that beats short third man. Stops just before the boundary, they scamper back for the third. That brings up the half-century stand as well
good length on middle stump, on his toes quickly to whip this to deep square
overpitched on leg stump, leans into it and tucks it neatly in front of deep square
full on the pads again and this time he nudges it between midwicket and mid-on
short and wide outside off, slashes hard at this but can't make connection
good length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
short ball at the ribs, swatted to deep square leg
steps out and plays a delighted bottom-handed whip that beats wide long-on. Right out of the top drawer
fired full on the stumps, turned towards midwicket

clobbered deep into the stands at deep square leg. This was at best a length ball outside off, not much turn and Maharaj swung this away. Into the grass banks. Free swing of the arms. Levels his career-best score
turns this length ball with the spin to short fine for a quick single

plays a delightful reverse paddle this time. Gutsy from a batsman approaching a century. Played this from outside off, rolled his wrists nicely to keep it down. Temba's father can't contain his excitement. The nightmare continues for Lyon
floats this a touch ahead of length on off stump, defended towards the covers
driven hard, the half-stop at cover is deflected towards mid-off

disconcerting bounce as Cummins bowls an effort ball, Temba is caught in a tangle as he looks to fend. Lucky this didn't pop up into the hands of midwicket. Bavuma wanted the second but Maharaj wasn't keen.

oh, dear. Maharaj can give you a lot of nerves especially if he's batting with a partner in the 90s. This is a wide slash outside off, can't get any control and gets a big nick to the keeper. He's done his job though, excellent knock.

Oh, dear. Anticlimax! Temba can't get a century. You have to feel for him as he looks up and walks off. This was a shortish delivery angling in from around the stumps, it's the uncomfortable length for Morne who fends with an angled bat, superbly taken diving across to the right at second slip. That's five wickets for Cummins. He'll be on a hat-trick when he comes out to bowl in the second innings
back of a length ball slanted across the corridor, left alone
good length on the pads, allows it to come on and nudges it wide of mid-on
good length and just outside off. No swing. Left alone
tonks him in the box with one that lifts from a length. Looks to defend this on angle but this has swung in a touch and gone past the inside edge
good length and some wobble outside off, left alone
outside edge falls safely in front of gully. Jabs at this length ball at the stumps and there's some skid away off the surface
nervous prod outside off. This is 141kph, some shape away in the corridor from back of a length. He taps it to gully
full wobbly ball outside off, gap between bat and pad as he looks to drive this. Trickles to mid-off off the toe-end
good length and shaping away outside off, left alone
good length length ball with some late shape away in the corridor. He pushes onto the front foot and pokes this into the covers
full inswinger at off stump, dead-batted down the pitch
beats the inside edge and it misses off stump too. Late swing into the batsman from Rabada from a good length
drops short of Markram at short leg. This is a length ball on the hips and he's looking to stab it behind square for the single
short of a length outside off, opens up his body and uses his wrists to carve this between point and gully. Bavuma gives chase and puts in a slide to rapturous applause
beaten on the outside edge as he defends inside the line this time. Cops it on the back thigh
good length just outside off, gets on the front foot and taps to mid-off
short of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
shot. Classy whip off the pads. This is a full inswinger and he brings in a nice big backlift to send this to the midwicket boundary
full and just outside off, a check-drive to mid-on

gobbled up by Faf diving to his left from second slip. Burns showed signs of nervousness through his prodding outside off in this short innings. It's his downfall in the end. Rooted to the crease as he chases this outswinger in the corridor with his hands, away from the body. Healthy edge that's headed for first slip but has a slight dip on it which makes Faf move quickly to his left and take it with a reverse cup
good length at off stump, dead-batted into the pitch
cops it under the arm as he looks to pull. This is a short ball angled across off stump
short of a length with some shape in, but he leaves this on height
short of a length and angled across off stump, left alone
short of a length and pushed across off stump, left alone
short of a length just outside off, movement away off the pitch. Left alone
good length outside off, blocked on the front foot
short ball outside off, left alone
length and slanted across off, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length just outside off, left alone
outside edge floats between third slip and gully. Khawaja looking to defend this length ball close to the body, but that spits up and catches the high part of the bat
short and wide outside off, left alone
inside edge onto front thigh. Front leg caught mid-way in the half-stride as he looks to defend this outside off
short of a length and into the pads. Allows it to come and nudges it fine for some easy runs
good length and just outside off. Left alone
full outswinger just outside off. This dips away late and fizzes past the outside edge. He wasn't expecting that much movement - that's the first sign of that
beaten again on the outswinger. Full and luring him into trying to drill this through cover and he's completely lost shape
length on the stumps, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
shot. Length at off stump, stands tall and taps it past the bowler on the up. Not too much feet, but the full face does it
feeble waft outside off as Rabada takes it away from a length. No feet again, hanging the bat out, well away from the body
good length outside off, no feet again as he pokes this on the up through cover
length ball just outside off, gets the bat inside the line to let it go
good length ball rising steeply in the corridor. Left alone on the front foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
leading edge through point and gully. Still no interest in the front foot stride. Stays rooted to the crease and looks to whip this length ball from the stumps but closes the face too early
good length outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, climbs past the outside edge as he looks to defend off the back foot
another. Length ball nipping away from a length in the corridor. Hangs the bat out and is beaten
good length outside off, left alone
short ball in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length just outside off, punched through extra cover on the up
good length and in at middle stump, air-borne as he flicks this. Straight to short leg on the bounce
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length in the corridor, left alone
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
full and just outside off, driven sweetly on the up to find mid-off
good length and just outside off, left alone
good length on off stump, watchfully pushed through extra cover on the up
good length on middle stump, thick inside edge to fine leg as he stabs at it with hard hands

got him! Some loose batting from Australia over the last 20 minutes. This is a length ball wide outside off. Not Philander's best. But Renshaw chases it well away from the body to try and thump it on the up through cover. A poor shot and it's simple catch
off the thigh as he shuffles to try and play the leg glance. Too quick for him, but the line's awry. Whistles past QDK
short ball down leg side, left alone
good length and wide across off stump, left alone
short of a length wide outside off, left alone
good length, too wide. Left alone
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot

drags it on! Oh what a disastrous start this is turning out to be. Handscombe goes the Du Plessis way - shouldering arms without any surety. This is an outswinger on a good length outside off. He gets close to the line with a shuffle but decides to leave late. Too late though, because the ball skids on to take the inside edge and clatter into the stumps
too wide, too short. Marsh lets this pass as it slants across him
good length in the corridor, anxious push forward to defend into the covers
full outside off, left alone
brave leave. Wow. This length ball's angling in before it pitches but nips away to miss off stump. How he knew that would happen, I don't know, but he's safe...
compensates and plays at the next one. And he's duly beaten. This jumps past the outside edge as he pushes forward
short ball in the corridor, gets on the back foot and pulls meekly off the toe-end of the bat through midwicket
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on it
whack. Nothing meek about this one. Morkel drops it short outside off and he gets behind it quickly to hammer it wide of mid-on with a flat bat
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length on middle stump, hangs back in the crease and tickles this into the midwicket area
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and in at middle stump. Defended on the front foot
tossed up on off stump, steps out and drives to long-on
length ball outside off, steps out and flicks to short midwicket
good length on leg stump, waits for it and whips it through square leg from the crease
good length on off stump, steps out and bludgeons this back at the bowler who is brave enough to stick out a hand and parry it to mid-off
floated up at middle stump, steps out and flicks uppishly towards midwicket where Bavuma can't gather it cleanly

big appeal for lbw as Khawaja pads this. Gould says not out, Faf reviews. This was spinning back in but that was a big stride. However, it's hit him on the back of the thigh as it spins towards off stump...missing leg stump! Oh that looked so close, but a good decision. South Africa lose a review
good length on off stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
