short of a length and angled in from outside off stump, left alone
beaten as he falls over into the off side. Marsh is still on the move as he walks into this ball in the corridor. Terrible position...
length in the corridor, left alone
beaten. Rising outside off and he pokes at it again
length ball fired down leg side, left alone
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
rapped on the pad as he steps out and tries to flick. He's beaten in flight
beats mid-off. Tossed up at a length outside off and he steps out and forces this past Morkel, who is quite wide there
length and down leg side. Shapes to reverse sweep and adjusts to tickle this fine as it comes in
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
superbly played. Length ball floated up outside off, steps out and hammers it wide of mid-off. He's been hitting them hard off the spinner so far
good length and in at middle stump. Tapped to mid-on, on the rise
length ball in the channel, thick outside edge as he looks to defend off the back foot
ambitious shot. Some would say woeful. It's a short ball wide outside off and he's sitting on the back foot, trying to pummel this behind square on the leg side with a pull
length ball down leg, not his first of the day. No need to play at that
back of a length and in at the pads. Jumps onto his toes and nudges this off his thigh to pick up four runs at fine leg
short ball down leg side, left alone
full on middle stump, defended towards point off the outside half
short of a length in the corridor, angles away and he leaves

looks to leave and cops it on the pad. There's a lot of this happening in this match. Short of a length ball nips in from off stump. He's looking to leave on height - in that sense, it's premeditated - and doesn't anticipate the movement
short of a length across off stump, left alone
sound? Looks like I'm the only one. Marsh squared up on the back foot and stabs at this length ball as it's pushed away from off stump
length ball in the corridor, left alone
short of a length outside off, tapped to mid-off from the back foot
good length just outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
good length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length and wide outside off, left alone
full on leg stump, flicked uppishly towards mid-on
short of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
slants a length ball across, left alone
angles across, the length is on the shorter side again, left alone. Can't get the batsman driving with that length
that's more like it. Much fuller and this one swerves in late. Marsh is rooted to the crease as he defends.
full and angling away from wide of the crease, Marsh watches this through to the keeper
back of length outside off, left alone
goes back and across as he dabs this length delivery to point. Three maiden overs in a row
short of length delivery outside off from around the stumps, Khawaja sways out of the way
goes across and turns this wide of short midwicket
lands this much fuller, the ball nips back in from wide of the crease, defended back towards the bowler
head still and in good position as he leans forward gently and defends back to the bowler
how did that miss off stump? Ooooh! Very, very close. Gets this to nip back in sharply from outside off, Marsh with a tentative leave. Trusted the bounce on this occasion
superb delivery again, jags back in to beat Marsh's tenative prod and hit him high on the pad. Superb bowling
floats this full and across Khawaja, who tentatively defends this into the off side
back of length delivery angling away, watched through to the keeper
solid in defence. Shows the full face of the bat to play that short of length delivery towards the bowler
driven and driven very, very well. Not smashed by any means. Just a gentle forward push, head nicely over the ball as he caressed that. This one just raced away
squared up by the length and late movement, squirted towards point
digs a short ball across the left-hander, who looks away as he ducks. Sure this zipped past.
bang on the money again. Length on middle, nips away off the seam. Marsh is forward as he defends
Plays outside the line, gets a thin inside edge onto the pad
Once again tentative in his footwork, prods forward and gets an inside edge onto the pad
slants a length ball across, left alone
works this back of length delivery on middle to the leg side
lunges forward to defend, gets a thick outside edge to gully
too short and punished. Khawaja stands tall and flays that through point. Lovely touch, lovely timing
back of length outside off, left alone
shapes to defend but lets it go in the end. This wasn't all that short, not all that full either.
floats this full and straight on the stumps, defended back
short of length on middle and leg, helped down to deep fine leg
gets this to lift from length outside off, left alone
walks across the stumps and defends a length ball angling away
looks to tickle it fine, but misses. Wrong line from Philander. This started from leg stump and went further down
chases a full and wide delivery, misses. Lucky. Walked across the stumps to thump that on the up.
shapes to drive but the length isn't there, much shorter than he expected. Gets a thick inside edge back to the bowler
superb delivery. Much fuller and closer to the stumps. Deviates away late, Khawaja pokes and misses
authoritative off-drive, excellent work by Elgar at mid-off.
big appeal, was there bat? Marsh is nearly beaten by the skid off the pitch as he looks to whip it away. Very close This may have smashed into the stumps. Oh, dear
pushed through quicker on middle, defended
quicker one outside off, keeps a touch low, defended back
goes back and across as he defends this shortish delivery back down the pitch
steps out and whips this from outside off towards wide long-on
sweeps and misses. This sneaked through the gap between bat and pad, luckily for Khawaja this didn't turn as much.
short of length delivery that jags away from middle, defended with soft hands.
beaten again. Squared up the sharp late movement as Philander slants this across
length on leg, this one holds its line to beat the inside edge and hit Marsh high on the box. Ouch
driven firmly but straight to mid-off. Didn't quite get to the pitch of it
on middle and leg, Marsh uses his wrists to pick the gap at deep square. Rabada runs around from fine leg to cut that off

hit on the back leg as Marsh leaves this length ball. I presume he anticipated this to jag away but this held its line. The back leg dropped down because he was lunging forward. Good decision from Nigel Llong.
gets outside the line of the stumps and pads this away
swept uppishly, on the bounce to deep square leg
pushed through quicker on middle, Marsh tickles this with the spin past short fine leg
advances and drives firmly to long off where Morne cuts it off

steps out, doesn't quite get to the pitch but whips this over midwicket to bring up his 12th Test fifty . Good to see the applause from the crowd, his mates stand up too. One bounce to the boundary. That had a touch of Kumar Sangakkara in it
turns this towards square leg for a quick single
length but sliding down, Khawaja misses
drawn forward to defend, gets an inside edge towards midwicket

brilliant catch by Amla, but Khawaja hasn't hit that. He looked to go after it, but pulled out at the last moment. De Kock, who was standing up to the stumps, went for the grab and this deflected to Amla off his glove. Stunning grab, spurt of excitement but no bat involved.
squared up by the length. Late movement away, defended from the crease
gets this short of length delivery to angle away, left alone. Thuds into de Kock's gloves

this time, he has been snuffed out down leg. I said this earlier that he was vulnerable to this against Morkel. But Philander has done the trick. Length on leg stump, this comes back in just a touch. Khawaja tickles it off the phase and de Kock takes an outstanding catch down leg. He may have been blinded because he was standing up to the stumps but anticipated well. Khawaja did all the hard work but will be very disappointed to have thrown it away.
steps out and whips to short mid-on
full and straight on the stumps, he lunges forward and defends
slower through the air, lands this outside off. Marsh lunges forward and blocks
could've so easily sneaked through. Steps out to drive, then decides to abandon that and just defend. Got an inside edge onto the pad as he pushed at that
gets outside the line of the stumps and turns this towards the leg side

QDK misses a stumping! Marsh ran down the pitch to drive, but the ball went straight on to beat him and hit de Kock on on his left pad as he tried to rise with the bounce. Chance nevertheless. Replays show just as the opportunity came, de Kock was stung by a bee That could've put him off
zips this back in from leg stump, Marsh hit on the pad
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends
shapes to drive, but the ball snakes back in to roll back off an inside edge
late inward movement from Philander, length much fuller too, defended back.
excellent leave. Slants a length ball across, wasn't too far from the off stump
bunts this length ball towards the off side.
fired full on the stumps, blocked.
kept low, beat the outside edge. No feet movement from Marsh.
lunges forward and blocks this tossed up delivery on the stumps
too short and clobbered. Made room and picked the gap at extra cover
right to the pitch of the ball as he blocks
touch slower this time, drags him forward but the ball spins away and Mitch leaves
thick outside edge but on the bounce to AB at third slip
length ball sliding into middle and leg, tucked towards deep square leg
back of length outside off, left alone
right behind the line of the ball as he bunts this with soft hands
gets right back and across as he defends this length ball

chopped on! That's not the kind of stroke you want to play 15 minutes away from stumps. Mitch Marsh goes for an expansive drive, bat comes down at an angle and flies off the inside edge to hit off stump.
lunges forward and deadbats this
gets outside the line of the stumps and deadbats
plays for the turn, but this one slides in, goes straight on and Marsh's daft forward push results in a nick to first slip. It keeps going from bad to worse for Australia.
squeezes this full delivery to mid-on
jabs this one to the off side, played with the bat well in front of the pad
squeezes this to backward point
gets this to lift off the deck and rap Paine on the gloves as he looks to defend. Ouch
right behind the line of this shrt of length ball as he defends
turns this wide of midwicket for a quick single
fends this short ball into the off side
once again gets on top of the bounce and keeps this out
uppish but he whips this nicely towards deep square, Rabada comes around to cut that off
fired full and flat from around the stumps, blocked
stopped on him but Cummins was through with the stroke. Slapped uppishly and just wide of cover.
goes for a big mow against the turn, beaten. Keeper and slip fumble, they take a bye. Big turn from the tough
pushed through quicker on middle, defended back
squeezes this full delivery towards point
lunges forward and blocks
lifter from length outside off, left alone
slants in, and then deviates a wee bit from length outside off, Paine leaves
back of length outside off, left alone
short of length delivery outside off, Paine watches this through to the keeper
tickled fine, races to the fine leg boundary. Easy pickings
back of length delivery outside off, left alone. It's stumps on day two
raps the pad with some late inswing from a good length. That's going down leg side. Starts too straight to cause trouble
good length and dipping away outside off, left alone
length outside off, left alone
looks for the outswinger from middle stump, but this full ball goes down leg side with the angle and past his flick shot
full outswinger outside off, teasing stuff. He's happy to leave
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
bounce. Just in case we'd forgotten. This lifts steeply from a length outside off and he leaves it alone
outswinger from wide of the crease. Starts outside off and Paine won't play
good length with a hint of shape away outside off, left alone
close to the stumps this time. Short and a tad wide though, he lets it go
good length in the corridor, left alone
good length just outside off, defended off the back foot
short ball coming in at off and middle. Solidly blocked on the back foot
good length outside off and rises up at him as he looks to drive on the up. It lobs aerially towards mid-off
short of a length outside off, left alone
length ball fired down leg side, can't get bat on it
full on middle stump, flicked uppishly towards midwicket. Not coming on too well...
short of a length just outside off and he nudges it through point off the back foot, first runs of the day
short of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length at middle stump, looks to defend on the back foot and it pings off the inside edge to fine leg's left
good length and wobbling in the corridor. Defends with a gap between bat and pad, gets it off the inside edge
what a ball. Glorious stuff. Slants it in at off stump on a good length and gets it to move away very very late. You can't do more than try and jab at it and hope. He's beaten
good length on middle stump, nudged wide of mid-on aerially
good length on off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
good length outside off, zips past the outside edge as he looks to defend on the back foot
slaps it over the fielder with some force. Paine's very good at the pull shot. Philander marignally short outside off and he's quickly onto the back foot to lift it over midwicket
good length on off stump, dropped into the covers off the front foot with soft hands
good length outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, handsomely punched off the back foot to short extra
short of a length outside off, left alone
beaten. Draws him forward in the corridor and zips it away off the seam
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball jumping in at the body. He cops it on the back thigh as he tries to negotiate on the back foot
length outside of, left alone
short of a length, slanted into the corridor. Lifts his bat high to leave this
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, blocked into the covers
good length on middle stump, feeble push on the front foot. Runs off the inside edge to fine leg
good length just outside off, left alone

this looks plumb. And Gould thinks so as well. He's given it. Paine reviews. Philander finally gets it full on middle stump and it nips in a touch and bounces up. It could be going down leg. Paine has missed the flick and is struck in front of middle and leg...but oh hang on! There's an edge on it. He'll survive. Ultra Edge shows a big disturbance. The wicket is retained, so is the review
good length and dipping away outside off. Left alone
short and wide outside off, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
spicy. Spits up at Cummins in the corridor as he looks to defend on the back foot. Catches him on the glove
good length outswinger outside off, left alone
close to beating the outside edge after zooming in at middle stump. Cummins just manages to get the outside half of the bat on this forward defence
short ball down leg side, allows it to pass
bouncer angled into the corridor. Doesn't manage to get the bat down as he sways back to let this go
good length on off stump, defended from the crease
short ball outside off. Backs away and slaps it to the cover boundary off the back foot. Real loose one to start from Maharaj
floated up slow at middle stump and he makes him walk into this defence. Feet rooted
rips past the outside edge. Superb pace from Maharaj this, keeping it below 85kph. Drifts in at a length and spins a long way away, with bounce
full and in at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
floated full on middle stump, shuffles for the sweep and just manages to get bat down on this. The bat comes down really late and it trickles past short fine
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short ball at off stump, defended into the leg side
good length on leg stump, flicked to square leg
full and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
flies past point as he looks to drive. It's not full enough for the shot and he ends up slicing with little control
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
indipper, full and in at middle stump. Jams it out with the toe-end
length ball on middle stump, gets down and is in full control as he paddles this uppishly to long leg's right
full on off stump, driven straight to extra cover
good length and dipping down at off stump. Draws him forward and spins past the outside edge
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, watchfully pushed to point
and why not?! Shuffles across decisively, gets down quickly as this is pushed flat, and swats it flat over the square leg boundary with a sweep
short ball at the chest, arches into the leg side and allows it to pass
short ball at middle stump, thuds him on the back thigh guard as he looks to defend on the back foot
inside edge onto pad as he looks to defend another short ball. This one doesn't rise as much at an off stump line
short ball wide outside off. Swipes at it for the upper cut and is beaten
short and wide again, but he won't look for the same shot - or any other shot - this time
good length on off stump, a late forward stride to defend to mid-off
good length at off stump and once again, he pokes well in front of the body on the forward defence and nearly falls over

oh how's that missed? It's a full ball on middle, he shuffles and is in a bad position to play the reverse shot that he's brought out. It sneaks through from behind his legs and somehow manages to miss the stumps. Gets the back pad and rolls in front of short fine who in the middle of all this hits the stumps with a diving throw. But Cummins has made it
leading edge as he turns the face too early at this. Not to the pitch of it at middle stump and it rolls past short third
length on off, defended on the front foot
full on off stump, tapped into the covers
superb shot. It's an arm ball skidding into the corridor from a short length but he does expertly to get deep in the crease and get this late cut past backward point
short ball wide outside off, looks to cut and misses
short outside off and finally manages to get bat. A straighter bat may be why. Punches it wide of mid-off
swipes and gets it over gully. Morkel's struggled all innings for consistency. Short and very wide. Cummins reaches out and practically throws his bat at this to get it off the thick outside edge
good length on off stump, defended on the back foot
and again. Short and wide. Reaches out and lifts this cut over the cover region. In control this time
good length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, draws him in and he walks into the forward defence
full on off stump, pushed down the pitch
full on off stump, tapped back to the owler
stunning delivery. Loop and dip. Paine's not getting close to that with his stride. It turns and bounces past the outside edge
full on off stump, driven to mid-off's left
short of a length and spins too far away outside off to get the edge. Beats him on the back foot
raps him on the glove, same hand as his injury. This climbs into the corridor from short of a length and cramps him on the cut. Lands short of the keeper
short and wide outside off, hammered to deep point off the back foot
good length and wide outside off, left alone
short ball outside off. Shuffles outside and has a jab at it away from the body. Beaten
very short, very wide, very ambitious swipe. Beaten
beats him. Length ball lifts off the pitch and past his outside edge as he backs into the leg side to defned
good length at off stump, leans in and drives to sweeper cover
good length and sliding in at middle stump. Defended into the leg side
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
full outside off, inside edge onto boot as he looks to drive through the off side
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
inside edge squeezes through from between QDK's legs. This is floated up outside off and he has a wild swing across the line at it
short of a length, bounces over off as he shoulders arms
back of a length stops on him a little as it climbs on and he fends it away awkwardly into the off side
slides across a fuller one on middle from around the wicket and Cummins blocks off the front foot
length ball, straightens on middle, pushes back and keeps it out
full on middle and off, blocked off the front foot
short of a length, flattish, shuffles across and blocks off the outside of the bat as it comes on with the arm
looped up outside off, driven to deep point
slides in a length ball on middle and off and gets it to rip past the outside edge with sharp turn
full and sliding on the pads, clipped through midwicket
stays dangerously back to a length ball and clumsily brings the bat down to defend into the leg side
drawn forward by the loop and beaten by the drift and turn outside off
crunches a sweep, bang off the middle, but wallops it straight to the man at deep square leg
drift and swing, pretty sharp outside off, not bothered with
length ball that holds its line outside off, left alone
fullish length, sharp swing outside the off-stump and left alone
length ball, slight movement away from the batsman and left alone
back of a length, tucked off the hips to square leg
full, away-swinger around the fifth-stump channel, leans into a drive to mid-off
length ball, draws him forward and gets it to spin past the outside edge
pitched up around middle, drive towards mid-on
short of a length, shuffles across, stands tall and punches firmly past the cover fielder. Beats him diving to his right
gets down for a wild slog, and though he hasn't found the middle of the bat, the hard swipe is still enough for the ball to trickle off the inside of the blade all the way to the midwicket boundary
full and tossed up on leg, pushed out to mid-on
that's been smacked. Maharaj loops one up outside off, and with the ball turning away, it gives plenty of room for Cummins to free his arms and mow it over long-on
short of a length, leaves him slightly and he punches off the backfoot to sweeper cover
fullish on middle and leg, turns it away to the on side
straightens around the middle-stump channel to find the outside of his bat and trickle away to cover
good length on middle and leg, blocked
leaves him prodigiously off a fullish length and Cummins offers no stroke
fullish on middle, punched to mid-off
looped up on off, blocked off the front foot
full and slid into middle, Paine clips to midwicket and pushes off for a really quick single
full and looped up on leg, Cummins hammers it one-bounce to mid-on who moves across and dives to his right to stop it
front-foot defense into the off side
in the air and safe. Paine tries to clip a fuller one and it lobs in the air before landing in front of square leg running in
steams in and fires a pacy length ball that leaves him outside off and Cummins offer no stroke
good length, straightening in the channel outside off, shoulders arms
short, wide, and straightish, left alone
slight movement outside off again and he lets it go
shot, caresses it along the ground and beats mid-on to his left. Philander chases it down, and it brings up the Australia's best partnership of the series. And it's Cummins' maiden Test fifty
full, leaves him outside off, but the late movement means he drills it back to the bowler off the inside of the bat

is that gone? Gould says not out and du Plessis almost instantly reviews. A loopy slider on leg stump, and Cummins gets down for a paddle. The ball lobs towards the backward short leg region where it's caught by slip moving across. He's actually not got any glove or bat on it, so it comes down to the lbw now. Pitches in line and hits him in front of middle. But the bounce may mean height could save him here. We wait for ball-tracking. Hitting middle of middle and off. Big partnership broken, and the Wanderers crowd finds its voice again. Big partnership broken, but remember that Australia aren't even close to avoiding follow-on yet
full and accurate on middle, blocked off the front foot
short of a length, shifts back and punches from front of off-stump
full on middle, defended down the pitch
gets the front foot forward and lets it go as it spins past the off-stump from a length
makes room and punches from perilously close to off-stump, point intercepts it
short of good length, angles in towards Paine's off-stump but he is so confident of where his off-stump is that he lets it go despite how close it was
short, sees some width and Paine opens up for a slash to third man
length ball on middle and leg, blocked to mid-on
short of good length, shuffles across towards off and keeps it out on the leg side
nips away late as he keeps his bat hanging outside off and drops short of gully after taking the outside edge
a loose shot, wildly slashes outside off, but fortunately for him, it evades a leaping gully fielder and runs away for four
loops up a full toss on leg, and it's been driven to mid-on where guess who's back? Big Morne Morkel moves across and slides to stop it
full on middle and leg, turns it away into the leg side
pitched up on off, blocked off the front foot
slider on middle and leg, defended
looped up on off and he keeps it out on the front foot
short ball down leg side, ramped towards Morkel at fine leg who gets an awkward bounce but stops it
full outside off, driven to mid-off off the toe-end of the bat
chips it over extra cover and it runs away from Bavuma. Another full ball outside off and he lifts it neatly, and deliberately, with a half-stride
good length on middle stump, tapped to mid-on on the rise
chipped to mid-off. Simple cricket. Rabada tells Lyon to try and do it again - floats it up full outside off. Lyon says alright and takes him on. Finds Elgar with a feeble lob
zips past the inside edge as he looks to defend this with no feet movement. It climbs over the stumps. Climbed from a length at an off stump line

dropped. Faf du Plessis puts down a simple one at short extra. It's a subdued drive from Paine who continues to be allergic to a big forward stride against Maharaj. Playing a long way in front of the body for the cover drive and it's at a nice, comfortable height - thigh high - and he just can't hold on
length on off stump, tapped to extra cover where Faf gets cheers for stopping it
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, left alone

got him at backward point. Another easy catch offered, gratefully taken. Short ball wide outside off, but with a hint of extra bounce on this pitch. Means Sayers gets a thick outside edge as he looks to cut. Amla doesn't have to move. Takes it comfortably
superb shot, but he won't take the run. Short ball at off stump and he gets in position so quickly to play the hook and find deep square
good length outside off, left alone
length outside off, left alone
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
past the outside edge as he pushes ahead to set himself up for a field maneuvering. Brings the bat down late as this swings away in the corridor
late outswinger and he allows it to pass in the corridor
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
inside edge zips past short leg. Plenty of extra bounce on that as he pushes forward to defend this length ball on middle stump
length on middle stump, pushed towards long-on off the front foot

bye bye! A monster hit from Paine to bring up a valiant fifty in his first Test as full-time captain. Tossed up on middle stump, he sets himself up by getting the front leg out of the way and clobbers this way over the midwicket boundary
tossed up at off stump, driven calmly to long-off
beaten outside off. This is a slider from Maharaj, pushed through flat on a length outside off and he can't defend it
good length outside off, left alone
full outswinger outside off, left alone
struck in front but that's probably going over. Length ball slanting in at middle stump and he can't get the flick away
good length outside off, turned into the square leg region with soft hands. Tactically placed to allow a second as deep square sprints in
short of a length ball at leg stump, tickled fine. Too simple

get out of here Dean Elgar! What a catch! Sensational. Sprints back some ten yards from mid-off, keeps the ball in his sight while looking over his shoulder, and then puts in a full-length dive after following the swerve to his right. Unbelievable stuff. Paine stepped out and looks to slap this over midwicket. It was a short ball and he ended up slicing it. Elgar had so much to do there and he did it all perfectly. Just stunning.
short of a length outswinger, left alone

falls short of short midwicket. Markram looks to flick and gets one that stops at him. This happened to him in the first innings as well, and he survived on that occassion too. This is a straight ball into the pads, not doing much
good length outswinger at off stump. Defended from the crease
good length on leg stump, tapped through midwicket on the up
short of a length in the corridor, left alone
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, some swing away. Defended on the front foot
good length outswinger outside off. Gets close to it and defends with soft hands. Gets it past gully off the outside half
good length on off stump, dabbed towards the slips with soft hands
good length and swung into the pads. Allows it to come on and gently taps it through the open square leg area
between the slips and gully. Late outswing in the corridor from Sayers. Markram is done in, but he has offered soft hands and survives again
length on middle stump, whipped on the up through square leg
good length on the stumps, blocked from the crease
short of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length outswinger in the corridor, left alone
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full and in at middle stump. Blocked on the front foot
good length outswinger outside off stump, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off. Beats the outside edge as he looks to defend on the back foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
short of a length outside off, stabbed to point off the back foot
good length at middle stump, dead-batted into the pitch
good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
good length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
offers the full face and gets this past the bowler. A gentle punch on the up against this length ball on off stump
short and wide outside off, wafts away from the body and misses
short ball angled in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
short of a length at leg stump, rides the bounce and dabs it to deep backward square
length on off, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, dead-batted down the pitch
good length on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
length ball spins and bounces away outside off as he looks to defend on the back foot
overpitched on middle stump, clipped to fine leg
good length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short ball lifting up off the pitch and climbing inwards. He arches back and allows it to pass
pulled to fine leg's right. He's quickly in position for the pull but the ball doesn't come on as quickly as he expects. Keeps it down though
full just outside off, defended on the front foot
short ball spinning outside off, left alone
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
short ball outside off, backs away and cuts to cover
good length slider in the corridor. Doesn't pick it. Leaves
back of a length just outside off, spits up as he pushes on the back foot to defend. Past the outside edge
good length ball climbs up and raps his thigh guard as he looks to nudge into the leg side
length ball outside off, shuffles across and blocks
shot! Reaches out and caresses it through the covers. Neatly picks the gap. Didn't try to hit it too hard so it's able to be pulled back
thinks of pulling this short ball but it cramps him up and gets up considerably and sneaks over the glove to the keeper
flashes at a length ball and holds absolutely no shape as he over-reaches and lets the ball go past the inside edge

no shot offered from Markram and he's been hit on the pad here. Appeal turned down. And that seems the right call. Seams back in sharply and bounces considerably to hit the high part of the pad. Would have probably missed the stumps
flicked through midwicket
comes down the track and tries to flick but gets hit on the pad as the ball lobs towards drops in front of short leg
length ball that spins in, shuffles and blocks
short of a length, lets it spin before patting it through square leg
good length, spins away towards off, blocked
pitched up on middle, clipped through midwicket, a fraction too full, and Cummins chases it down to pull it back just in time
length ball that spins in, turns it away to short leg

ah, what a delivery! Cummins even gets optimistic and enquires about a possible glove on that. Forces him to arch back by banging in a short delivery that curves in further and really well-done by Elgar who neatly sways out of the way and arches his back and holds his balance
length outside off, blocked
shortish around off, jumps and keeps it down on the leg side
shortish, angled in at off, jumps back and blocks
short of good length around the fourth-stump channel, stands tall and defends
stays back in the crease and turns away this back of a length delivery into the on side
good length, shapes away from the fourth-stump channel, left alone
curves away from a length outside off and he covers the line with a big stride before blocking
tries to drive a fuller one that shapes away and it goes off the inside of the bat to midwicket
sharp awayswinger, leans into a gentle drive through the covers
length, similar shape, defended
opens the face to a back of a length delivery and guides it to point
shortish, gets on top of the bounce and taps it to point
short of a length, shapes away outside off and Elgar shoulders arms
length ball that holds its line, left alone
shot! That's a terrific strike. A short ball and he's in absolute control of that shot. Not one bit harried by the bounce, rolls his wrists over the pull and keeps it along the ground to midwicket
short of a length, angled in, keeps it down on the leg side
short, crunches a pull bang off the middle but he had to fetch it from well outside off and ends up dragging it to mid-on
length ball that keeps a little low outside off, stays in the crease and keeps it out
full and curving away, covers for the movement with a big stride and blocks

was that a chance at midwicket? Nah, not by any stretch of the imagination. An uppish clip off the pads, midwicket dived to his left but Markram had placed it well wide of him and crunched it to the midwicket boundary
overcompensation from the bowler. Shortish, plenty of width, Markram slaps it late through backward point
another short one, this time Markram plays the cut a little early, allowing sweeper to get to it after moving to his left
good length ball that cuts in from outside off and finds the inside part of Elgar's bat as he defends from the crease
length ball that keeps a little low outside off, kept out
directs a fuller one at leg stump, Markram closes the face early and gets a leading edge to cover
back of a length, angling in, tucks to deep fine leg
fullish length, lots and lots of width outside off on offer, Elgar frees up and punches it through the covers
back of a length at leg stump, tucked off the pads through square leg where Burns flings himself to his left and stops a potential boundary
back of a length, a lot more accurate line on middle, Elgar keeps it out from the crease and deals well with the relatively low bounce
pitched up on middle and leg, clipped past short leg with the turn for a brace to midwicket
draws him out of the confines of his crease with loop and flight and Markram smothers the turn
sharp turn from a length, thinks of nudging it and holds back at the last minute
full around off, front-foot defence towards short leg
length, spinning in on middle and off, blocked
flat and sharply turning in from outside off, nudges it towards short leg
was there an inside edge. Seemed like there was an extra noise. A back of a length delivery that cuts into him and pins him in front of middle but the angle was pretty sharp
short of a length, holding its line and left alone outside off
jumps back to a back of a length delivery and drops it into the covers for a quick single
short of good length, subtle shape away from the right-hander and lots of extra bounce as well, sticks the bat out and promptly gets beaten
reaches out to a full awayswinger and slices a drive off the outside part of the bat through backward point
short of a length, tries to tuck it away and the ball goes off the pad to the fine leg region
lets this length ball spin into him and taps it away to deep square leg. That's 1000 career runs for Markram. The second fastest South African, after Graeme Smith, to the mark
pitched up on middle and leg, blocked down the pitch
spins away from a length outside off, left alone
full on middle and off, driven back
ooh, what a brute from Lyon! Turn and bounce, spins away outside off and gets real big on him to leave him completely squared up. Unfortunately for Lyon, it misses everything

Cummins finds the outside edge, and it's of the in-form batsman. A length ball, probing him in the channel outside off. Markram pushes forward and gets an outside edge that's taken at second slip by Handscomb

beautifully bowled! A length ball that nips away from outside off and Amla keeps his bat inside the line. Just about enough movement but if he fires it a little closer to the batsman to make him play, that'd be perfect
similar shape but a much shorter length and Amla lifts the bat to let it go
length ball, continues to find some shape away and Amla brings his bat down real late to chop it towards gully
full, sliding towards leg, clipped past midwicket and they take three by the time the ball's pulled back
good length around middle, Elgar inside-edges it to the boot as he tries to turn it away into the on side
pitched up around off, blocked
shuffles across and keeps out a length ball towards gully region
waits for this length ball to spin into him, and dabs it very late past the right of short leg
slider around leg, blocked off the front foot
fullish, spins away from middle and off, and Elgar defends off the outside of the bat as it spins away
short of a length, backs away and stands tall before stabbing it through the cover region
full around off, late away movement, Amla blocks into the covers
full around off, driven straight back to the bowler
good length around off, Amla covers his off-stump and blocks
short of a length, a bit of shape away, Amla shuffles and jumps before defending with an open face
shortish, angling down the leg side, Amla tries to move across and tuck it away but the ball drifts past him
length ball, subtle late movement outside off, no shot from Amla
slapped through cover. Dropped short with plenty of time outside off with the slow turn. Elgar rocks back and cuts hard
back of a length, pitching on middle, spinning towards first slip. Dead-bats it off the outside half
full on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, left alone for the turn
96kph, wide of the crease and a lower release. But this spins away outside off and Elgar leaves comfortably
good length outside off. Defended towards gully with soft hands
good length outside off, left alone
good length in the corridor, pushed to point off the outside half
good length on off stump, defended to midwicket from the crease
good length outside off, left alone
good length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length and spinning away outside off, poked to point off the back foot
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
well left. Length ball outside off, good pace at 81kph, dipping at him. Turns away
flat, good length at the stump. Blocked off the back foot
short ball outside off. 83kph. Misses on the cut. Gets it to extra cover off the toe-end
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot

ping and over second slip. Whew. Some weird physics on that edge, like a video game glitch. Length ball in the corridor that he looks to dead-bat into the pitch with soft hands. But it takes the shoulder of the bat and lobs well over second slip
good length outside off, left alone
leading edge as this one seams away and keeps low. Length ball at off stump and Amla goes deep in the crease and jumps to try and flick this
short ball wide outside off, left alone
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
short of a length ball at leg stump. Can't get on top of the bounce as he tickles this past leg gully off the back foot. Slip gives chase
94kph, beats the outside edge. Elgar antsy on the forward defence, doesn't get a big stride in outside off
short ball outside off, a late cut to backward point's left
short of a length and spinning into leg stump. Nudged to deep square off the back foot
good length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, follows with his hands and gets beaten
short of a length wide outside off, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
good length and in the corridor, left alone
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
bouncer dug in too short to make him play, he lets it sail down leg side after ducking
big inswinger raps him just outside off. Not out says Gould, impact outside. That swung in a long way and caught him halfway through the forward stride on the defensive
tossed up outside off to draw him forward, and then he gets it to spin past the outside edge
tossed up at off stump, driven back at the bowler
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended to point off the outside half
short of a length outside off, spinning away sharply. Left alone
arm ball. Pitches on middle and that's probably why Elgar survives. He's playing for the spin on the front foot but this takes the inside edge in front of leg and trickles into the leg side
good length just outside off, left alone
good length and in at middle stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
short ball in the corridor, arches back to let it go
short ball at the ribs. Springs up and fends this towards fine leg, one-handed
short ball outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, defended close to the pad on the front foot
taken at leg gully but that's spun straight off the pitch down leg side. No bat as Amla gets down for the sweep
pushed aerially through the leg gully region. That fielder had just moved to leg slip. Couldn't keep this leg glance down as it climbed on him
lovely. Gets to the pitch of one at off stump and lifts it straight over the bowler with the full face of the bat. Neat. Effective.
good length on middle, defended on the front foot

beats the outside edge and off stump! What a ball that is. Again, evidence of the slower ball being effective. This is 82kph from Lyon and Elgar is in two minds about the forward press. Decides very late to go back but by this time the ball has already turned and he's forced to follow with this hands
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, left alone
good length and just outside off, defended on the front foot
well-directed bouncer. Dips in towards the helmet as he gets under it
full on middle stump, punched to mid-on off the front foot
good length on leg stump, pushed through square leg with soft hands
pitched up on off and spinning in, driven off the inside of the bat to mid-on
gets a big stride across off to defend and gets hit on the pad

turn and bounce does Amla in. A length ball that spins in and bounces considerably. Amla tries to shuffle across and tuck it away but inside-edges it to the thigh pad before it lobs towards Mitchell Marsh at backward square leg
sharp turn from a fullish length, AB makes use of it to whip it to deep square leg
looped up on off, Elgar puts his head down and defends solidly
short and straightening around off, Elgar backs away and opens up his arms to lace a cut through point
good length outside off, AB comes forward and punches to cover before taking off for a quick one
fullish length on off, blocked off the front foot
Elgar pushes hard at a wide one and sends a thick edge flying through the gully region
straightens from a fullish length, about a set of stumps outside off, Elgar shoulders arms
short of a length, angled in from outside off, jumps and drops it through the point region with a firm backfoot punch
that's a gift to end the over. A full leg-side delivery that's been clipped easily off the pads through fine leg
full, sliding on leg, clipped to short fine leg
makes some room by backing away and tries to force a cut but finds cover
fullish length outside off, blocked off the front foot
curving in towards off and then straightening, and that's a sensational leave from Elgar as he trusts the angle and turn and bounce
brings the bat down real late and defends a length ball with an open face
fullish, spins away from middle and opens Elgar up slightly as he defends
good length, slight late movement outside off, left alone

bounce again accounts for another batsman. Did that kick up off one of the cracks? It was a length ball but gets up like a bouncer. De Villiers is already getting in line to punch that ball and is suddenly taken aback. Does all he can to try and get out of the way but the ball nips back in to find the outside edge of the high part of the bat. Paine snaffles the catch
fullish length, holds its line outside off and he lets it go. Needs to be careful, that could be dangerous if the ball nips back in even slightly
good length, this one moves away towards the fifth-stump channel, du Plessis blocks off the front foot
length ball, presses forward and drops it into cover before taking off
what a brute from Cummins! Shortish, angled in towards Elgar's off-stump and then straightening and bouncing prodigiously to nearly shave the outside edge
spins in sharply from outside off and goes past a half an attempt at a flick to hit the high part of the pad
a lot less turn this time from outside off, and he arches back and punches through cover and point
fullish, spins away, finds the outside of Elgar's bat as he blocks off the front foot
in the blockhole on leg stump, Elgar squeezes it out

is that a sign of things? Elgar tries to clear the in-field and clears the front leg. But he takes himself away from the line of the delivery and it also spins away, and as a result, he skews it off the toe-end but it lands safely. Could that signal a change in intent?
turn and bounce, left alone outside off
nudges a length ball into the leg side for a quick one
pins him on the pad with a length ball that angles in. Elgar jumps and tries to flick and gets hit on the high part of the bat. Kind of caught on neither foot there
short of good length, holds its line, Elgar lets it go outside off
short of a length, angled in towards off and nipping away late, Elgar isn't interested in going after that
short, wide, too much bounce as Elgar slashes at it. That one again bounced so considerably. Elgar may have needed to stand halfway up a ladder to have a chance at making contact with that one
angled in from wide of the crease, Elgar trusts the angle and leaves it alone
spins in too much and drifts down the leg side as du Plessis tries to flick
loops one up outside off. Du Plessis takes a stride across and gets down on one knee to crunch a sweep through square leg. SA definitely getting a move on here
nudged with the turn to short leg
advances slightly and smothers the turn after meeting the pitch outside off
shuffles across and withdraws his bat as this length ball spins in considerably and hits the pad
curves in around the fifth-stump channel and spins away, left alone
stopped with the boot in the follow through. Firm drive from Faf du Plessis against this full ball on off stump. A good shot and a frustrating result for a man out of form
short ball outside off, leaves it
beautifully timed. Length ball outside off. He leans in and is forced to use his wrists because he's not to the pitch of this. But he does it perfectly to get it through the open covers region
length ball outside off, left alone
low full toss at off stump with some movement inwards. Looks to drive but this drags wide of mid-on off the toe-end
short ball in the corridor, left alone
tossed up at off stump, defended on the front foot
short ball outside off, left alone
full on middle stump, tapped down the pitch off the front foot
quicker one, back of a length at off stump. Defended on the back foot
floated up at a length outside off. Left alone
good length ball at off, spinning away from him. Left alone
good length ball just outside off, defended on the front foot
length outside off, pushed towards point off the front foot
good length outswinger, just outside off, left alone
good length, bending away outside off. Left alone
back of a length just outside off, poked into the covers off the back foot
full outside off, driven straight to mid-off
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up outside off, tapped to short extra cover on the up
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length on off stump, climbing away outside off. Left alone
huge turn, pitching outside leg and climbing into the corridor. He looks to block on leg stump and has no idea after that
length on middle, spinning away, left alone
good length outside off, late movement away as Faf shuffles and stabs at this away from the body. Beaten
good length outswinger, left alone
good length on leg stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover
length ball swung in at leg stump. Allows it to come on and tickles it fine
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
full outside off, dead-batted into the pitch
length ball outside leg stump, offers the pad and cops this on the elbow
length ball outside leg. Offers the pad. It lobs off the pad and lands on him. He didn't know where that went
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full on middle, driven to mid-on
good length on off stump, dead-batted into the pitch
good length outside off, defended off the back foot
good length on middle stump, defended to midwicket on the front foot
good length outside off, defended to extra cover on the front foot
good length outside off, left alone
good length ball, late inswing and it keeps low. Gets the bat down just in time to avoid being trapped in front. It trickles to fine leg
good length outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length and spinning in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
short of a length and keeping low as it spins in at middle stump, goes on the back foot and whips to long leg
overpitched outside leg stump. Kicked away.
slingy action. Full on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and in at off stump. Left alone for the turn
arm ball fired in at a good length on middle. Blocked hurriedly on the front foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot

gets him on the index finger. This Chadd Sayers fella is a hazard to fingers. Gets a length ball to climb up at Faf, who is looking to flick this through square. Immediately chucks the bat away. That's a heavily-strapped finger that has been broken recently....
good length ball dipping in late and bouncing off the pitch. Defended with the bottom hand coming off
full on middle stump, punched to mid-on off the front foot
full and swinging away. Opens the face and taps this to point
full outside off, left alone
falls short of cover point. Length ball wide outside off. Chases it with his hands and ends up slicing it
length ball outside off, left alone
length outside off, pushed flat, left alone
floated up at off stump, left alone
tossed up outside off, left alone
good length on middle stump, defended from the crease

looks better than it's hit, but it's four over the bowler's head. It's off the low part of the bat, so he might have felt that in the index finger. Length ball coming in at him and he opens the face to chip this straight
good length on off stump, defended from the crease
good length outside off, left alone
smash. Too easy. Dropped short on off stump, and he swivels to pull this well in front of square. Right off the middle of the bat
length outside off, left alone
good length on off stump, defended into the off side
runs! Elgar goes on an adventure - gets the front leg right to the pitch of this ball and closes the face to flick this through midwicket
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length on off, blocked on the front foot
outside edge falls short of gully. Spits up at him but he defends with soft hands outside off
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length, wide outside off. Left alone
oh well bowled. Length ball slants in and rips away from him like a legbreak as he looks to block on the front foot
full on off stump, driven back at the bowler
short ball rising up outside off. Leaves it
short ball wide outside off, left alone
good length outside off, punched to mid-off on the up
spins away from a fullish length and blocks off the front foot
short of a length, spins away, shuffles across and blocks
short of a length, shifts back and tucks to deep midwicket
sharp turn into his leg-stump, tries to help it along and wears it on the pad instead as it goes to short fine leg

ah, streaky!. Du Plessis advances down the ground and swipes but the ball turns in so sharply that he loses all shape and gets an inside edge - a mild deflection - that sneaks past the left of the keeper after barely missing the stumps
makes use of the overspin Lyon gets to tuck through square leg
length ball, fired a set of stumps outside off and drifts away further as he shoulders arms
good length on off, du Plessis defends in front of off and the extra bounce almost hits the finger as he withers the back hand off the handle
short ball, angled in and he barely has to get under it
short of good length around the stumps, backs away and blocks off the backfoot
back of a length, drifts away outside off and he shoulders arms
cuts in and keeps low. Du Plessis stays back to a delivery that's just back of a length and he barely jams the bat down. Skews it away towards the gully region off the outside of the bat
curves in on a length around off and turns and bounces, no shot offered
length ball, shuffles and blocks inf front of off
slider on leg, turns it away behind square against the turn
allows himself to get opened up as he plants the front foot down and blocks down the pitch
too full around middle and off, hits the blockhole, jammed out to mid-on
spins like a legbreak, and delivered like one. Elgar stays on the backfoot and blocks as it spins into him
short ball, cuts away off the deck and that gives him the room he's looking for. Du Plessis gets on top of it just enough to smash it through the covers
good length on the fourth-stump channel, blocked
full, sliding into the pads, pushed out to the leg side
short of a length, jumps up and blocks in front of off
short, snorts over off as du Plessis pulls himself out of the way
beauty! Hazlewood finds the right length, just short of a good length and close enough to off-stump to make him fish at it before getting it to cut away off the deck and rip past the outside edge
back of a length, outside off, Elgar lets it go
length ball, Elgar plants the front foot and blocks
front-foot defence to silly point
that's the line. Need that more often. Slides it on a length into leg stump and gets it to spin away, has Elgar off guard as he keeps it out
makes some room and cuts to cover
back of a length and sliding into middle and leg, Elgar backs away slightly and manages to keep it out
full outswinger outside off, left alone. Some early swing for Hazlewood
good length in the corridor. Left alone
good length at middle stump. Late swing in. He defends to midwicket
good length on off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
good length ball in at the pads and he nudges it past square leg off the inside half of the bat
good length on off stump, solidly blocked on the front foot
good length wide outside off, left alone
length ball wide outside off. Hits the pitch and dies on the way to the keeper. Also rips away like an offbreak...that was in the rough
short of a length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot
beaten as he looks to steer this through point. Short of a length ball lifts up, wide outside off
good length just outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, goes away off the seam. Left alone
full outswinger, wide outside off. Left alone
good shot. Short ball doesn't rise too sharply as it comes into him. He swivels and swats it away to the square leg boundary with full control
length ball just outside off, defended into the covers
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
short ball just outside off, left alone
short ball outside off, left alone for bounce
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
nicely timed, but won't get this through. Short of a length ball outside off, punched straight to cover
good length on off stump, stabbed to extra cover off the front foot
full ball outside off, reaches out for a flowing drive to cover
good length and in the corridor. Looks to go forward on the defence but this spits up at him and he's forced to defend with the bottom hand off
good length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
good length just outside off. Tapped to mid-off on the up
good length ball outside off, left alone
length ball coming in at middle stump. Nudged to midwicket off the back foot
short ball at middle stump, tapped to midwicket's right off the back foot
short ball, wide outside off. Left alone
well bowled. Bangs it in on a length, just outside off. Looks to defend and this fizzes past the outside edge
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
short ball just outside off, left alone
good length outside off, defended to gully off the outside half

length ball lifts in at leg stump and once again Faf chucks the bat away and clutches his right hand after looking to fend this off. It has missed that problematic index finger and has got him on the forearm. Oh, no. Nope. He's taken the glove off and it is, in fact, his index fnger.
short ball in the corridor, left alone
good length and just outside off. Defended on the front foot
good length just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length ball down leg side. Looks to nudge this fine but cops it on the pad
short ball wide outside off, can't reach as he looks to pull
good length outside off, looks to stab it through cover. Gets it to midwicket off the inside half
short of a length wide outside off, left alone
length ball at off stump, stays deep in the crease to defend and takes his bottom hand off as this makes contact
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

reviewed straightaway. Australia think they have Faf caught behind. This is a good bouncer, climbing up from short of a length. He's looking to hook and there's a sound as this goes past him and through to Paine. Faf indicates it's his helmet...and replays suggest that as well. Nothing on Ultra Edge as the ball passes bat. He's safe. Another one of many good decisions from Llong in this Test. Australia lose the review...
short of a length just outside off, left alone
slapped away on the up. Length ball wide outside off and he makes no attempt to keep it down. Thumps it wide of mid-on, aerially
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, tapped to point off the back foot
length ball and in at leg stump. Loud applause for Elgar as this trickles into the square leg area, but Gould has his leg up! This glance won't count as runs off the bat
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball into the pads, clipped to deep square off the front foot
fullish, turns it away with the spin to short leg and takes the back hand off after feeling some discomfort
pitched up outside off, and du Plessis has shovelled that forcefully through midwicket with powerful wrists. Much-needed fifth for the SA captain
Lyon loops another one up outside off and du Plessis crunches another powerful sweep through square leg. Over the short leg fielder and away to the boundary
shifts back to a back of a length delivery and tucks it past the right of forward short leg
drifts and turns outside off, left alone
straighter length ball around off, minimal turn but lots of bounce as Elgar shoulders arms
length ball, swinging away outside off, left alone by du Plessis
fullish and accurate around middle and off, blocked
that's been thumped. Skips down the track to get right to the pitch and just flays it with brute force over extra cover
full and tailing away, driven square of the wicket to deep backward point
there it is! Finally!! Elgar with his first runs of the morning and his first in over 70 deliveries. And he gets it by reaching out for a very wide delivery and carting it over the in-field
fuller, pushed out to mid-off
turns it away with the spin to forward short leg
fullish, spinning in, dabbed late behind the short leg fielder
huge appeal for lbw, but the impact was definitely outside off. Du Plessis shuffled across and missed as he brought the bat down to flick with the ball keeping low

oh, jeez, has du Plessis struck the short leg fielder? Yes, bang on the helmet. A crunching sweep that bounces off the back of his helmet as he ducks. They don't take the run as they check on handscomb, and he's fine
another big sweep, fetched from outside off, and du Plessis gets it past the short leg fielder this time. Bashed away to deep square leg
full, Elgar presses forward and drives down the ground and du Plessis inadvertently stops the ball as it hits his bat with him grounding it to remain in the crease
length ball, tucked into the on side with the angle
full and wide, crunches a drive but straight to cover
oh, the anticlimatic feel to it all! Elgar, after spending what looked like forever on 39, carts this over long-on with a hue charge down the ground
length on middle, defended
pitched up outside off, clipped to deep midwicket
straightening on the fifth-stump channel, left alone
fuller and spinning away, defended off the outside of the bat
jams the bat down late and blocks this into the off side
lets it spin away and then shoulders arms
angled in and straightening on middle, blocked
short of a length outside off, stands tall and punches to cover
back of a length, shapes away, and du Plessis make use of the additional room to punch past the left of extra cover off the backfoot
full and tailing into the pads, clipped of then to deep backward square leg
full, defended with the angle to mid-on
short of a length outside off, punched through the covers
ooh, nearly shaved the outside edge as Elgar fishes for one outside off
lets this length ball spin in and defends to short leg
shifts back and uses the turn to knock it to short leg
shifts back and lets this spin down the leg side as he lifts his bat
walks across and sees the turn and bounce and there isn't much he can do about it as he gets hit on the front pad
full outside off, flicked off the front foot to midwicket
is that another blow on the finger? Nope, but almost as this kicks up from a length and spins in and he takes the back hand off as he attempts to block

Elgar raises his fifty like a boss. He's in such great form, just extends his arms to muscle this fullish one, fired in from wide of the crease, with the angle over long-on. Well over long-on. A massive six
short of a length, drops it in front of point and wants a single but is sent back by his captain
back of a length, holds its line and Elgar leaves it
short of a length, angling in, Elgar defends almost one-handed into the off side
shortish outside off, Elgar waits and opens the face really late to punch to deep backward point where Renshaw slides and stops it in front of the boundary
holding its line and left alone outside off
flat non-turning length ball, shuffles across and blocks
full outside off, clipped to deep midwicket
turns away and he sticks the bat out real late to get an outside edge that bounces in front of and goes over first slip as he gets down
length, spinning in, lobs in the air off the thigh guard. Was there an edge? Well short of Handscomb at short leg in any case
shuffles and blocks in front of off
short, flat, and he backs away and punches to deep point
short, spinning away, gets on top of the bounce and punches to sweeper cover
shifts back and tucks to deep square leg
length ball on off, Elgar drops it to cover and point and wants a run but is sent back by du Plessis
defended down the pitch
comes on with the arm outside off, left alone
pitched up outside off, blocked
length, looped up on middle, nudged to short leg
top-edge on the sweep. It's a length ball, and so not full enough, but sails well over square leg
gets down early to another length ball and then holds back for a split second before crunching a sweep off the middle of the bat to deep backward square leg
turn and bounce! Draws him forward with a length ball and then rips past the outside edge
tossed up around off and Elgar blocks off the front foot
outside off with the angle, it's left alone
brings it closer to the batsman, still outside off and Faf punches it off the back foot through the covers
beats him with some turn! Elgar prodded forward for a length ball on the stumps and takes it on the back pad. Pretty high
more towards the pads now and it's tucked away to leg
slightly quicker and outside off, he leans forward and blocks
flat and short, bit of turn into du Plessis, he goes back and helps it to midwicket
overpitched outside off and Elgar drives with the turn
nicely bowled, pitches it on middle and leg an d Elgar has to open up a bit to defend the length delivery
from wider of the crease and he beats Elgar with the turn. It was well outside off and Elgar was probably tempted to drive
goes for a wild heave now for the length ball. It was on length and turning away from well outside off, trying to break the shackles
similar ball outside off, he gets close to it and leaves
edges it and it reaches second slip on the bounce. Elgar prods and gets a thick edge but it's safe
short of a length and pushed across off stump, left alone
short ball outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short ball outside off, cut to sweeper's left
short of a length and spinning in at off stump. Backs away and jabs into the covers as this gets big on him
good length outside off, defended to point
short at middle stump, defended off the back foot
tickles it past leg gully. That's a very fast one from Lyon - 108kph. Fired at leg stump and he shuffles and tickles. Flies to the fielder's right
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, defended to short leg on the back foot
full outside off, flicked to short leg off the front foot
tossed up outside off, plonks the front leg down and crashes this to the midwicket boundary with a sweep. Faf into the nineties
good length, swinging in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
floated full outside off, tapped into the leg side off the inside half
good length on middle stump, stays firm in the crease and pushes in front of the body. Gets it wide of mid-on
good length on off stump, defends on the front foot and gets the bottom hand out of the way
good length outside off, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length ball, dips in at his off stump and nips away off the pitch. Beaten on the front foot
good length and in at leg stump, tapped into the leg side on the up
full inswinger at middle stump. Front leg rooted again and he reaches out in front of his body. Goes with hard hands and looks to go with the swing - gets it through square leg off the inside half
length outside off, left alone

shot! Fully in control this time. Front foot down the track, but with enough room to swing the bat, which he brings down from the direction of first slip and then lifts this over midwicket using his wrists, with the swing
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length and shaping away in the corridor. Left alone
full glory. Faf plants a confident front foot down the track at this length ball in the corridor and thumps it past the bowler with the full face presented
length ball fired down leg side. Paine leaps to his left, one-handed, and can only parry it towards fine leg
good length outside off, looks to get on the front foot and gets it into midwicket off the inside edge
good length and pushed across off stump. Left alone
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper's right off the back foot
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
bouncer at a leg stump line. Too short. Ducks under it easily
good length in the corridor, left alone
good length on leg stump, tapped in front of mid-on from the crease
inside edge onto pad and it lobs into the leg side. Looks to get forward against this ball coming in at off stump
good length and late swing away outside off,  stabs it to point off the front foot
short of a length outside off, tapped to cover off the back foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone

smiles at the umpire as he completes this run. He is getting into the troll zone. Waits till Faf reaches the crease and signals leg byes. This is a length ball angled in at the pads and he was looking to tickle it fine
short of a length outside off, deflected fine off the thigh guard

outside edge and Test century! Eighth Test century, brought up with the use of nine fingers. Oh, how he's needed this. It's a good ball - wobbling in the corridor at a good length - and he stabs at it tentatively. It sails past second slip
bouncer down leg side, ducks under it

crack! Misfield. That ball fizzes across the turf after Elgar gets on the back foot and slaps it through midwicket. Lyon is on the boundary out there and the ball almost orders him to get out of the way with the fury at which it's going. His tumble is not good enough to get the stop in
short ball in the corridor, dropped into the covers with soft hands
good length outside off, left alone
good length and jumping in off the seam to hit his back thigh. Looks to defend on the front foot and is beaten on the inside edge
good length outside off, lobs it over mid-off on the up
short ball outside off, chopped to deep point

gets it over sweeper cover with a slice. Not fully in control of that. It's an outswinger outside off and he wants to go inside-out over extra cover. He isn't to the pitch so he has to end up using his wrists a lot more. Not too well connected either, but it evades Burns out there
short ball outside off, hammered on the up to sweeper's right
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
short of a length on leg stump, whipped towards fine leg off the back foot
full ball in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
falls short of extra cover. Nathan Lyon there, can't quite get his hands under this cut shot. Short of a length ball outside off
ugly heave after stepping out. This swings away and climbs in the corridor as Faf runs down at it
short ball outside off, punched on the up to extra cover's right. Lyon dives to field
a slower ball from Sayers. Yep. On a length at middle stump, easily nudged wide of mid-on off the front foot. He lobs it back at the keeper who misses the ball and it's an overthrow behind the cordon
walloped. Short ball in the corridor. Quickly onto the back foot and powered away to the midwicket boundary with a pull
overpitched outside off, opens up his stance and looks to cream this through extra cover. Gets an inside edge into the leg side. Nothing new to see here...
stung by this length ball coming in at off stump as he manages to nudge it into the point region
length on off stump, defended off the back foot

good catch. Another top one from Handscomb at second slip. After a long time, Faf goes forward at a length ball and gets exactly what he's been fearing - one that climbs. Gets it off the shoulder and it lobs to Handscomb's right. He leaps two-handed to snap it up. A solid, brave knock from Faf after averaging less than 10 in the series coming into this Test
short ball lifts up on him as he goes on the back foot to defend

Gould gives the lbw and Bavuma reviews straight away. Gould thinks this has beaten the inside edge, Bavuma thinks otherwise. There's no doubt on line, it's him on the back thigh right in front of off stump. This will be overturned...yep, big edge. Not out.
full on off stump, flicked through square leg
good length on off stump, thick outside edge lands short of gully as he goes forward to defend
length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, spitting away from the corridor. Leaves it alone

top edge and it's taken by Shaun Marsh running back from extra cover. Lyon finally manages to find an edge from Elgar, and it takes an attempted slog sweep. Length ball spinning away from off and he's not close to the pitch of this as he plays the shot. Marsh and mid-off have a decision to make, but it's all handled nicely in the end
full, curving in on the pads, clipped away to midwicket
full and attacking off, de Kock absolutely hammers it and finds mid-on
full and wide, flays a drive through covers to the left of the fielder at sweeper
short of a length, angled in, tucked to midwicket
good length on fourth stump, pushed into cover for a quick one

that's plumb. But de Kock reviews straightaway. Pushed across on a fullish length around off and then straightening to hit him in front of middle. No inside edge on the attempted flick and taking out the top of middle
short ball that gets over middle and leg, easily ducked under

missed chance. Spins in sharply from a length and finds the inside edge of Bavuma's bat as he tries to flick but the ball gets past the left of the keeper. It then carries to leg slip who fails to get down in time and grab it
sharp turn, left alone as it goes down the leg side
sharp turn again, goes back and across and flicks on the bounce to leg slip
that's how you counter sharp turn if you're Bavuma. Gets down for a reverse sweep and sends it racing through point
nudged with the turn to short leg
length ball with a hint of shape outside off, left alone
good length, slower at 129ks, Philander works it behind square off the inside of the bat
length ball that holds its line outside off, left alone
fullish length outside off, blocked down the pitch
full, angles in towards off and then shapes away, pushed into the covers
fullish length, holds its line outside off, left alone
drifts in towards middle but Bavuma manages to reverse sweep through cover and point
shifts back to a length ball and turns it to short leg
length, spins in, dabs it to fine leg
shuffles towards off and pats it down towards short leg
top-edge on the reverse sweep, trickles down through the vacant third man region. Lead up to 550
shuffles and waits before whipping it with the turn to deep square leg
back of a length, tucked to deep midwicket
short of a length, a little shape away and he flicks it from outside off to midwicket
full, shaping away, presses forward to cover
back of a length, nips away, Bavuma shoulders arms
shortish, Bavuma chips a flick to square leg and then pushes back for two as the man at the deep runs in and fires a throw to the bowler
short, cuts away off the deck after being banged in, Bavuma sways out of the line
pitched up outside off, driven to long-on
full, clipped to midwicket
shuffles across and turns it away to the on side
pitched up outside off and Philander uses the room on offer to free up his arms and slog this over the cow corner region
length, minimal turn into him, backs away and chops a cut to point
pushed out to long-off
beauty! A fullish delivery, angling in towards off and nipping away ever-so-subtly to beat the outside edge
back of a length, shapes away, blocked
left alone outside off
big stride forward and blocked into the covers
length ball outside off, blocked
fullish length around off, worked away behind square on the leg side
length, spinning in, nudged past the left of the keeper
good length, shifts back and turns it away through square leg
back of a length, spinning in, flicked to square leg
backs away and cuts towards point
another biggie from Philander. Lyon floats this up outside off and Philander sees the room and senses the opportunity to open up his arms to muscle it over long-on
back and across and blocked
fullish, shapes away and goes off the outside edge past the diving gully fielder
length ball, shapes away towards off, defended down the pitch
short of a length, shapes away and finds the outside edge that goes between the two slip fielders and gully
good length on leg stump, punched to mid-on
another outside edge. How many more of those are we going to see tonight? Full and shaping away again and again it goes past cordon and gully
length on off, swings away as he tries to defend
good length, sharp turn that hits the pad outside leg stump as he turns around looking to flick
gets down for a big sweep but the drift and turn are too sharp and he can't make any contact
turns a mile and nips away down the leg side
length ball, spins in and hits the pad  but with Bavuma shuffling across, the impact was outside off
whipped away with the turn behind square on the leg side
pitched up outside off, front-foot defence
short of a length outside off, gets on top of the bounce and flicks towards midwicket
fullish, pats it away to mid-on
back of a length, drifting towards leg and brushing the pad as it trickles away to fine leg
switches over to an outside off line and pitches it up, driven through cover
length ball, shapes away, left alone
full around off, driven to mid-off
short of a length and ripping in at off stump. Goes on the back foot and shapes to cut but this scythes through between his bat and body. Paine can't stop it
short of a length at leg stump, nudged through square leg
back of a length and in at leg stump. Whipped uppishly through square leg
short of a length and spinning in at off stump, slices to backward point
