short of a length at middle, tapped to square leg off the back foot
dropped short on middle stump, but it gets too big on him as he pulls. He manages to lift it over the infield and gets it out to deep midwicket
good length on off stump, defended from the crease
length on leg stump, tapped into the leg stump
short ball shaping away from off stump, has a stab, beaten
<strike>sleeves rip off as he flexes his muscles, screams 'Wakanda Forever!' and smashes this out of the continent</strike> blocks on the front foot in front of off stump
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
good length on leg stump, dabbed into the midwicket region from the crease
full outside off stump, leans in to push wide of mid-off off the front foot
short of a length and spinning in at off. Cramped on the back foot punch, taps it into the covers instead
square leg misses this but long leg covers up. Short ball whipped off this hips and it looks like he's done by the turn there
oh nicely done. Gets low and well forward to get behind this outside off and then he taps it on the head to get it fine with a paddle sweep
short of a length on leg stump, dead-batted into the pitch off the back foot
length on leg stump, stabbed to midwicket on the front foot
good length on off stump, pushes forward and defends with the bottom-hand coming off
good length outside off. Inaugurates the coming of the new willow by getting an inside edge onto pad as he looks to drive through cover
full ball in at leg stump. Leans in and taps this wide of mid-on
good length and jumping in at the groin as he looks to defend on the front foot. Snuck that past the inside edge
good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
beaten. Length ball outside off, draws him forward, cuts it past the outside edge

Rabada seems to have got Renshaw first ball! Gould gives it as Renshaw gets something on this while trying to leave in the corridor. It lifts up at him and QDK is up straight away. Renshaw reviews...it's off his tricep. That will be overturned. What an explosive start!
good length and slanted across off stump, left alone
good length and pushed across off stump. Left alone
133kph, length ball slanted across the corridor, left alone
beats the outside edge. Renshaw chases one outside off on the front foot and skids past him. 134kph
short of a length just outside off, defended towards gully off the back foot
good length with some shape away in the corridor. Defended off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
short ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
inside edge as he pushes outside off to defend on the front foot. A hint of outswing and he followed it with his hands
short of a length outside off, left alone
130kph, short of a length across the corridor, left alone
135kph, short ball just outside off, left alone
the set up. Tries to bring one back from a full length, but he loses the radar. It's 138kph, his fastest of the innings, but it's down leg
short of a length outside off, left alone
137kph, good length and past off stump as he leaves
140kph, good length on off stump. Defended on the front foot
full and wide outside off, left alone
length on leg stump, nudges it deftly into the square leg region
length ball shaping away. He's delivered that from close to the stumps. Defended on the back foot
beats the outside edge. Welcome back, says Philander. Did this to him quite a bit in the first innings. This time he does him with late swing as he tries to defend outside off
outside edge as he brings the bat down late and inside the line of this ball that cuts away after pitching
length ball on the pads, deflected behind square off the pad as he looks to flick
length on middle stump, with some climb as he gets behind the line and dabs this to fine leg
good length outside off, left alome
short ball outside off, extra bounce. Left alone
full outswinger just outside off, defended to mid-off
shoulders arms and is struck on the back pad. But he's well outside the line and this is rising up too

shoulders arms again! This one is full and slanted in and strikes him outside off too. On the back leg. Once again, they won't review although Rabada is seriously interested this time. Maybe it didn't come back enough...would've been clipping says tracker. Umpire's call. So it would've remained not out.
short ball outside off, left alone
good length across off, left alone
full at off stump, uppish drive to wide mid-off

dropped? Yes. This pops right out of Bavuma's hand at gully. Doesn't usually field there, but this is a simple one. Length ball on off stump and a loose drive from Renshaw without any feet. Healthy edge, carrying at shin height and he can't wrap his palms around this
length and in at the stumps. Blocked from the crease
length on leg stump, nicely timed flick wide of mid-on but Morkel slides to his left and stops it
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball swinging away outside off. Left alone
137kph, escapes with an inside edge. This is a length ball sliding in at off stump and raps him on the pad
137kph, raps him on the pad again. Burns having a difficult time at the moment. Can't get bat on this skidder at off stump. Hits him high on the front leg

shot. Superb hit. The front foot tactic isn't working for him, so he hangs back for this length ball and trusts it to bounce just enough for a pull. Drags it from just outside off and sends it over deep square leg. Bit of Ponting in that shot.
short ball down leg side, left alone
length ball in the corridor, climbs steeply as he leaves. Gets his triceps out of the way and all
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off, blocked on the front foot
full outswinger outside off. Lunges forward and jabs with hard hands to get this wide of mid-off. Not a great shot to be showing Philander...
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length ball wobbles in the corridor. Left alone
tempted to drive but lets this go. It's a full, teasing outswinger outside off
short ball pushed across the corridor, left alone. Dies on QDK
good length on middle, blocked on the front foot
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
full and into the pads. Clips it wide of mid-on off his toes
short of a length and in at leg stump. Struck on the pad as he looks to flick this off the back foot
short of a length outside off, tapped to point off the back foot
whacked into the foot of short leg. Aiden Markram cops one there from a thunderous sweep. Some part of the shin guard protecting that part of his leg and he's on his feet
length on off, blocked on the front foot
skids on and he just gets bat on this as he pushes onto the back foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
starts off with a pretty accurate fuller one around off that Renshaw keeps out from the crease

appeal for leg before. Ian Gould turns it down. Angle is too sharp and height may be an issue there too. Morkel pins the pad with a back of a length delivery that beats an attempted flick. As he turns around swiftly to go up in appeal, he clutches his side
good length, subtle movement - just about enough to leave Renshaw hanging his bat loosely outside off and gets him beaten
full and curving in at 139ks, driven back off the inside of the bat
length ball in the corridor of uncertainty that tails back in late, left alone
draws Renshaw out with a fuller one at 136ks around the fifth-stump channel, driven out towards mid-off
pats it away to the leg side
width on offer, back of a length, Burns hangs back and opens the face to guide it through point
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
short and he makes some room before forcing a cut to point
shortish and spinning away, this time he arches back and gently taps it away through backward point
raps the pad with a slider that angles in really sharply and would have missed leg
length ball that holds its line outside off, 130ks, left alone
length ball, tails in late and Renshaw shoulders arms
back of a length, left alone outside off

tat's plumb. Wicket for Morkel in his final innings. And the glee on his face tells how much this means to him. And it's a lovely length. Fullish and curving in. Renshaw misread the angle and gets his stride a little too across. Ends up getting hit below the knee-roll and no doubt on anyone's mind that that would have gone on to hit the stumps
fullish, just outside off, these are tempting lines and lengths, Khawaja shuffles and defends back to Morkel

there again, getting him to push hard at one away from the body, but fortunately for Khawaja, the ball was a little too full and took the outside edge from the low part of the bat and does not carry to gully as a result
sliding fuller one on middle and leg, blocked
floated up around middle and leg, defended on the front foot
shifts back to a sliding back of a length delivery and drops it into the off side
full and sliding on leg, bad line from Maharaj and he is duly punished with a sweep through backward square leg
pitched up on leg, clipped out to backward square leg region
meets the pitch with a big stride forward and wears it on the pad as it spins in with the bat behind the pad
good length around the fifth stump, holds its line and Burns shoulders arms
short of a length, nips in slightly, Burns is sure of the bounce and his off-stump, and lets it go
good length at off, blocked back
length ball at 133ks, left alone outside off
slightly fulish this time and sliding into the pads at 130kmph, clipped away through midwicket

superb placement. Khawaja leans into a drive and perfectly splits cover and point. Rabada - lower back strain and all- sprints behind the ball like his life depended on it and slides in front of the boundary to pull it back. Or has he? They go upstairs to check and it's absolutely fine
advances down the ground and carves this loopy fuller one away through the right of Amla at cover
pads away a flighted one outside off
gets the pad outside to one fired outside off, and it spins away the other way after hitting the rough
again gets a big stride across and gets hit on the pad as it lobs to first slip off the pad
sharp spin into the pads, off them into the hands of short leg. No bat
advances down the ground to smother the turn but this one turns and kicks up from a length to hit him on the high part of the torso
length ball, holding its line, left alone outside off
that's a brute! Drawing Burns forward with a length ball in the corridor and then getting it to prodigiously seam off the deck to flash past the outside edge
short of a length, away movement off the deck again and Burns shuffles across to block
short of good length, well away from Burns to make him play
fullish length outside off, front-foot defence towards mid-off from Burns
good length on the fourth-stump channel. This is good bowling - he's relentlessly probing away in the channel. Burns is up to the task as he blocks solidly down the pitch
length ball skidding low outside off. Dabbed towards short third man off the outside off

he's been given lbw from well outside off. Nigel Llong doesn't think a shot is offered. Khawaja has reviewed. This looks very out it there's evidence that he hasn't offered a shot...it's a length ball keeping low and headed for off stump. He shuffles too much and is caught on the move. No shot offered, it appears...decision upheld. Khawaja says he offered a shot there, he's not happy with the decision. His bat is behind his right thigh though as the ball hits him below the knee on the left leg. It's hard to conclude from the footage that a shot was offered, there's some distance between the line of the ball and the bat. That ball is spinning in and hitting off stump
length ball on off stump, steps out and blocks the ball
beaten on the front foot. Looping, drifting ball pitches on off and climbs rapidly as he looks to defend form the crease
floated up at off stump, steps out and drives to mid-off to steal the single
short ball outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length ball wide outside off, left alone
gorgeous cover drive. Full ball wide outside off, leans in and transfers the weight nicely into this to get it past extra cover
outside edge slides between third slip and gully. Length ball just outside off, keeps low and he offers soft hands at this to keep it down
length and in at the stumps. Blocked on the front foot
length ball outside off, left alone
cuts away and climbs to square him up. It's angled in and he's looking to defend into the leg side
nicely done. Length ball on off stump, steps out to reach the pitch and drives it wide of mid-off with the turn
length on off stump, steps out and drives neatly to mid-off
length on off, steps out and dead-bats it
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
short ball outside off, cut to sweeper's right
full on middle stump, swept to long leg
length on off stump, steps out and yorks himself. Jams it into the covers
good length on off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
good length just outside off, defended off the back foot
sensational bowling. Some wobble as it lands on a length outside off and then a sharp deviation away to get Burns to chase it with his hands. Past the outside edge
good length in the corridor, left alone
good length in the corridor, poked through point off the front foot

whoosh! Over second slip. We saw one go steeply yesterday off a full ball, and this is a repeat. Length ball in the corridor that he looks to defend on the back foot, but this flies well over the cordon
full on leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
sweet. Burns pulling out some nice strokes today. Length ball on off stump and he gets a good stride in and caresses this to the square leg boundary
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full on off stump, tapped back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, punched to sweeper cover
length outside off, defended on the front foot
shuffles outside off and flicks this from in front of off. Risky shot. Barely gets bat on it and gets it to square leg
length outside off, jabs from the crease and is beaten as this bounces past
full on off stump, defended towards backward point
short of a length outside off, left alone
inside edge as he looks to defend on the front foot. Onto pad, he's safe
length ball, nips away slightly outside off, and Burns shuffles across to protect off-stump before blocking
fullish around the same channel, Burns defends hard into the surface
short of a length, shuffles across and blocks
good length, angled in and straightening around the fourth or fifth-stump channel. Philander oversteps
fuller around the stumps, driven back
poor lines from Philander, too full, and Burns clips off the pads through midwicket as two fielders give it a chase
back of a length, slight shape away from the right-hander's off-stump. Handscomb lets it go

Morkel strikes again. And it's of the well-settled Burns. He's having a pretty delightful final innings here, is Morkel. This one's full and curves in and dips real late to leave Burns making no contact as he tries to clip it away. Plumb in front of middle and leg. Burns consults his partner but rightly decides to walk away without reviewing
full and dead straight but too wide outside off to make the batsman play
full and angling in on off stump, blocked back
full and attacking off-stump, Marsh keeps it out with a straight bat
uncertainty from Marsh. Gets a stride forward and makes a really late decision to withdraw his bat. Too late and he inadvertently makes contact as it goes on the bounce towards a packed cordon
length ball, Marsh waits for it before turning it away with the angle into the leg side
too much flight as Handscomb steps down the track and drives the full toss to mid-off
flat length ball outside off, shuffle and block down the pitch
hurriedly defends this length ball off the outside of the bat
looped up outside off, advances and drills to mid-on
steps down the track and makes use of the width to open up and crash a drive through the covers
full, pushed on the front foot to cover
beautiful shot! Handscomb advances down the ground and meets the pitch before crunching a picture-perfect drive through extra cover
length ball, tucked to the leg side
back of a length, spinning in, tucked away through midwicket
full and slight spin away on off, defended
pitched up on off, blocked
length ball, gets him forward and to play at it, spins away and drops in the vacant silly point region off the outside of the bat

was that a drop? Maharaj flings himself full-length to his right, but nah, it's hit the non-striker's bat. Maharaj didn't get anywhere close to it. Handscomb advanced down the ground and just hammered this fuller one straight back
front-foot defence down the pitch
edged and past AB at first slip. Shuffles across and hangs his bat outside off as this one spins in slightly from well outside off
looped up around the fourth-stump channel, left alone
full on off, driven to point
big stride forward and pushed into the off side
advances down the ground and pushes towards mid-off and takes off for a really quick single. That's a risky single at this point of time
lets this length ball turn and then defends late towards point
length ball outside off, Marsh gets his pad across and lets it lob towards the region between keeper and slip off the pad
pitched up around off, blocked off the front foot
short of a length, spinning away, stands tall and blocks
full and curving in on middle and leg, blocked
advances down the ground and whips this full toss wristily through midwicket. Beautiful shot. Elegant
advances down the ground to smother the spin but it's a slider and he finds the inside part of his bat
loopy length ball, spinning away outside off, left alone
turns and bounces from a fifth-stump line, Handscomb lifts his arms and loses balance
comes down the ground and drives it straight into the ankle of Bavuma

got him first ball! If that's not lbw, then he's caught in the slips...yep, caught at gully. An inside edge onto pad as Marsh looks to defend on the front foot. It's hard to say if that's an lbw appeal because Philander runs straight down the pitch in celebration even before the catch is taken. The perfect inswinger from him, good length, nipping in from off to middle and he catches Marsh halfway through his stride. Bavuma takes a simple lob with no fuss
full and just outside off, defended to extra cover off the front foot
good length and just outside off. Defended to gully off the outside half

no Marsh runs today, says Philander! That's his 200th Test wicket too. Oh what a start to the day. Length ball just outside off, makes him nudge at it because it's oh-so-close. It's a fitting way for Philander to reach a milestone. Marsh goes with hard hands and tickles it for QDK
outside edge falls short of third slip! Philander is in a hurry to get to the Morne farewell party. Length ball lifts off the pitch in the corridor, Paine unable to manage this as he tries to defend
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg
length ball on leg stump, nudged through square leg off the back foot
inside edge as he goes back to an outswinger that then goes rogue and cuts back in at off stump
full on off stump, rooted to the crease as he looks to defend. Trickles through square leg off the inside half
outside edge falls short of third slip. Defends with soft hands in the corridor
good length outside off, left alone
full ball just outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
good length outside off, beaten as he looks to defend on the front foot
length outside off, jagging away and lifting sharply outside off. Beaten as he stabs at it
good length outside off, left alone
good length on off stump, defended through cover off the front foot
good length on off stump, defended to cover from the crease
short of a length just outside off, gets deep in the crease and defends
good length, dipping away in the corridor. Left alone
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
good length just outside off, defended off the back foot
good length just outside off, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball into the pads. Deflects into the slip cordon as he misses out on the flick
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length and just outside off. Nippins back in and he exposes off stump as he leaves. That is close.
good length on off stump, goes deep in the crease to defend
good length and shaping away from a middle and off line. Watchfully defended off the back foot

drags it on while trying to leave. Repeat performance. Same bowler, same line, same intent, same result. Outswing just outside off and he can't get the bat out of the way quickly enough. That's his 50th wicket against Australia
short of a length just outside off, left alone
outswinger wide outside off, left alone
length on middle stump, tapped into the leg side
good length outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
good length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length just outside off, left alone
length on middle stump, tapped in front of mid-on with soft hands
length ball rising up in the corridor, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
good length just outside off, tapped into the point region off the back foot
short of a length and lifting up at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length ball just outside off. Drops it into the covers with soft hands
shot. But can't pierce the field. Length ball driven firmly on the up, but Faf dives to his left at mid-off to stop this
good length ball keeps low, but he manages to watch this closely and block on the back foot
tossed up at off stump, driven to mid-off
full on off stump, dead-batted on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, left alone
floated up at off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length on off, blocked on the front foot
full at off stump, inside edge onto boot as he looks to drive on the front foot
good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot as this spits up at him
inside edge as he looks to drive on the up. He's not to the pitch of this outside off. Saved by the pads
outside edge won't carry to gully. Another one spits off the pitch as he looks to defend on the back foot

gets him! Three length balls in the corridor of different flavour. That's the genius of this man. Draws an edge off each of them and on this occasion, Paine can only manage to guide this to the keeper. Drawn forward outside off and he can't defend this rising ball
past the outside edge. Lyon late on the forward defence
tossed up on off, driven to mid-off's left
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, defended towards short third man off the front foot
length on off stump, defended off the inside edge
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
shoulders arms, lose off stump. Very late inswing from a length outside off Cummins expects it go away and has the off stump exposed as he tries to leave. Tonk. Five-wicket-haul
taken at third slip! Oh man. Another bowler with the prospect of a hat-trick. Syaers chases a full and wide outswinger and gets a thick edge. Straight to Elgar at third slip
blocks it! Length at off stump, slight tail away. Solidly blocked in the end
length just outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
beats the outside edge. Wobbly ball slanted across the corridor on a good length
starts with a no-ball! Full and wide outside off, Lyon is beaten on the outside edge as he tries to defend
126 kph, full and wide outside off, a good, confident leave from Lyon
too wide from Morne, 127 kph, not his quickest. Left alone.
back of a length, this one seaming back in, a thick inside edge onto the pads. Trickles close to the stumps.
128 kph, that will reduce the margin of defeat! Back of a length outside off, Lyon cuts through point for a couple.
that will be four! 130 kph, short and wide and Lyon sees an opportunity for some international runs. Slashed away through point.
just past the outside edge, 125 kph. A full delivery in the channel outside off, the ball just misses the outside edge! Stunning delivery.
a full delivery, around off, 127 kph. A leaden-footed poke to cover.
back of a length outside off, 129 kph. Hazlewood stands tall and punches the ball to mid-off
no man there and that will be four more. On the pads and Hazlewood tickles him fine, through fine leg.
short of gully! Back of a length outside off, Hazlewood prods, the ball dies in front of gully.
close to the outside edge, but does not find it. Back of a length outside off, the ball just beats the edge again
back of a length on middle, 127 kph, worked away towards midwicket
full and straight, 131 kph, blocked away to mid-on, full face of the bat.
nice and full, that pace moving up steadily. On a length, pushed to mid-on, 133 kph
past the outside edge again! 133 kph, full in the channel outside off, the ball moves past the outside edge.
back of a length outside off, 133 kph, pushed away to mid-on
full and wide, eliciting a drive but the ball flies away past the edge.
another stunner of a delivery from Morkel! Lyon nods his appreciation. A good length delivery, fourth-stump channel. The ball goes past the outside edge.
nicely done! Australia need under 500 now. Overpitched from Philander, Hazlewood stays in his crease and lofts the ball delectably over mid-off for four.
good length outside off, 126 kph. Blocked back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, 127 kph, the ball moving back in. Blocked
129 kph, back of a length outside off, the ball beats the bat easily. That length leaves Hazlewood poking.
nicely behind the line again, 128 kph, full around off, blocked away
back of a length around off, 124 kph, a thick inside edge towards square leg. Hazlewood will take strike. Morkel will be pleased.
full and wide, drifting away. Hazlewood drives but makes only contact with the ground as the ball flies past
flat outside off, defended back
through the inside edge, slow outside off, the ball drifts in and beats the inside edge, big gap between bat and pad
past the outside edge this time. Flat and wide. more drift. Hazlewood pokes
slow outside off, he gets forward and smothers the ball back.
edged, but falls short of second slip! 83 kph, full and wide, the ball drifts on, takes the outside edge and lands in front of Amla.
133 kph, a full delivery around off, Lyon drives, and it goes flying through cover for a couple.
the yorker on middle and leg, 130 kph, jammed out by Lyon
full and straight, a thick outside half as Lyon drives. Point fields.

driven away with terrible timing through cover! 137 kph, full and wide outside off, Markram chases after it from point. And it's a risky two. Markram's loopy throw is close to Quinton de Kock, and he takes off the bails with Lyon inches short! That's out and SA win the series 3-1!
